story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: To Sherlock Holmes she is always THE woman. I have seldom heard

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: him mention her under any other name. In his eyes she eclipses

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: and predominates the whole of her sex. It was not that he felt

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: any emotion akin to love for Irene Adler. All emotions, and that

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: one particularly, were abhorrent to his cold, precise but

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: admirably balanced mind. He was, I take it, the most perfect

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: reasoning and observing machine that the world has seen, but as a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: lover he would have placed himself in a false position. He never

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: spoke of the softer passions, save with a gibe and a sneer. They

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: were admirable things for the observer--excellent for drawing the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: veil from men's motives and actions. But for the trained reasoner

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to admit such intrusions into his own delicate and finely

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: adjusted temperament was to introduce a distracting factor which

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: might throw a doubt upon all his mental results. Grit in a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: sensitive instrument, or a crack in one of his own high-power

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: lenses, would not be more disturbing than a strong emotion in a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: nature such as his. And yet there was but one woman to him, and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: that woman was the late Irene Adler, of dubious and questionable

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: memory.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: I had seen little of Holmes lately. My marriage had drifted us

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: away from each other. My own complete happiness, and the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: home-centred interests which rise up around the man who first

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: finds himself master of his own establishment, were sufficient to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: absorb all my attention, while Holmes, who loathed every form of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: society with his whole Bohemian soul, remained in our lodgings in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Baker Street, buried among his old books, and alternating from

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: week to week between cocaine and ambition, the drowsiness of the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: drug, and the fierce energy of his own keen nature. He was still,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: as ever, deeply attracted by the study of crime, and occupied his

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: immense faculties and extraordinary powers of observation in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: following out those clues, and clearing up those mysteries which

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: had been abandoned as hopeless by the official police. From time

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to time I heard some vague account of his doings: of his summons

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to Odessa in the case of the Trepoff murder, of his clearing up

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: of the singular tragedy of the Atkinson brothers at Trincomalee,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: and finally of the mission which he had accomplished so

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: delicately and successfully for the reigning family of Holland.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Beyond these signs of his activity, however, which I merely

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: shared with all the readers of the daily press, I knew little of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: my former friend and companion.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: One night--it was on the twentieth of March, 1888--I was

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: returning from a journey to a patient (for I had now returned to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: civil practice), when my way led me through Baker Street. As I

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: passed the well-remembered door, which must always be associated

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: in my mind with my wooing, and with the dark incidents of the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Study in Scarlet, I was seized with a keen desire to see Holmes

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: again, and to know how he was employing his extraordinary powers.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: His rooms were brilliantly lit, and, even as I looked up, I saw

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: his tall, spare figure pass twice in a dark silhouette against

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the blind. He was pacing the room swiftly, eagerly, with his head

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: sunk upon his chest and his hands clasped behind him. To me, who

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: knew his every mood and habit, his attitude and manner told their

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: own story. He was at work again. He had risen out of his

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: drug-created dreams and was hot upon the scent of some new

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: problem. I rang the bell and was shown up to the chamber which

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: had formerly been in part my own.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: His manner was not effusive. It seldom was; but he was glad, I

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: think, to see me. With hardly a word spoken, but with a kindly

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: eye, he waved me to an armchair, threw across his case of cigars,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: and indicated a spirit case and a gasogene in the corner. Then he

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: stood before the fire and looked me over in his singular

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: introspective fashion.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Wedlock suits you," he remarked. "I think, Watson, that you have

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: put on seven and a half pounds since I saw you."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Seven!" I answered.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Indeed, I should have thought a little more. Just a trifle more,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: I fancy, Watson. And in practice again, I observe. You did not

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: tell me that you intended to go into harness."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then, how do you know?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I see it, I deduce it. How do I know that you have been getting

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: yourself very wet lately, and that you have a most clumsy and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: careless servant girl?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "My dear Holmes," said I, "this is too much. You would certainly

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: have been burned, had you lived a few centuries ago. It is true

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: that I had a country walk on Thursday and came home in a dreadful

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: mess, but as I have changed my clothes I can't imagine how you

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: deduce it. As to Mary Jane, she is incorrigible, and my wife has

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: given her notice, but there, again, I fail to see how you work it

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: out."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: He chuckled to himself and rubbed his long, nervous hands

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: together.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "It is simplicity itself," said he; "my eyes tell me that on the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: inside of your left shoe, just where the firelight strikes it,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the leather is scored by six almost parallel cuts. Obviously they

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: have been caused by someone who has very carelessly scraped round

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the edges of the sole in order to remove crusted mud from it.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Hence, you see, my double deduction that you had been out in vile

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: weather, and that you had a particularly malignant boot-slitting

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: specimen of the London slavey. As to your practice, if a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: gentleman walks into my rooms smelling of iodoform, with a black

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: mark of nitrate of silver upon his right forefinger, and a bulge

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: on the right side of his top-hat to show where he has secreted

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: his stethoscope, I must be dull, indeed, if I do not pronounce

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: him to be an active member of the medical profession."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: I could not help laughing at the ease with which he explained his

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: process of deduction. "When I hear you give your reasons," I

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: remarked, "the thing always appears to me to be so ridiculously

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: simple that I could easily do it myself, though at each

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: successive instance of your reasoning I am baffled until you

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: explain your process. And yet I believe that my eyes are as good

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: as yours."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Quite so," he answered, lighting a cigarette, and throwing

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: himself down into an armchair. "You see, but you do not observe.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: The distinction is clear. For example, you have frequently seen

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the steps which lead up from the hall to this room."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Frequently."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "How often?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Well, some hundreds of times."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then how many are there?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "How many? I don't know."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Quite so! You have not observed. And yet you have seen. That is

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: just my point. Now, I know that there are seventeen steps,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: because I have both seen and observed. By-the-way, since you are

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: interested in these little problems, and since you are good

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: enough to chronicle one or two of my trifling experiences, you

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: may be interested in this." He threw over a sheet of thick,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: pink-tinted note-paper which had been lying open upon the table.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "It came by the last post," said he. "Read it aloud."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: The note was undated, and without either signature or address.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "There will call upon you to-night, at a quarter to eight

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: o'clock," it said, "a gentleman who desires to consult you upon a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: matter of the very deepest moment. Your recent services to one of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the royal houses of Europe have shown that you are one who may

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: safely be trusted with matters which are of an importance which

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: can hardly be exaggerated. This account of you we have from all

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: quarters received. Be in your chamber then at that hour, and do

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: not take it amiss if your visitor wear a mask."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "This is indeed a mystery," I remarked. "What do you imagine that

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: it means?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: one has data. Insensibly one begins to twist facts to suit

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: What do you deduce from it?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: written.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: endeavouring to imitate my companion's processes. "Such paper

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: could not be bought under half a crown a packet. It is peculiarly

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Not at all. The 'G' with the small 't' stands for

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: 'Gesellschaft,' which is the German for 'Company.' It is a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: customary contraction like our 'Co.' 'P,' of course, stands for

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: 'Papier.' Now for the 'Eg.' Let us glance at our Continental

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Gazetteer." He took down a heavy brown volume from his shelves.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Eglow, Eglonitz--here we are, Egria. It is in a German-speaking

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: country--in Bohemia, not far from Carlsbad. 'Remarkable as being

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the scene of the death of Wallenstein, and for its numerous

text: glass-factories and paper-mills.' Ha, ha, my boy, what do you

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: make of that?" His eyes sparkled, and he sent up a great blue

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "The paper was made in Bohemia," I said.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "Precisely. And the man who wrote the note is a German. Do you

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: what is wanted by this German who writes upon Bohemian paper and

text: prefers wearing a mask to showing his face. And here he comes, if

text: I am not mistaken, to resolve all our doubts."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You had my note?" he asked with a deep harsh voice and a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: strongly marked German accent. "I told you that I would call." He

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: looked from one to the other of us, as if uncertain which to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: address.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Pray take a seat," said Holmes. "This is my friend and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: colleague, Dr. Watson, who is occasionally good enough to help me

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: in my cases. Whom have I the honour to address?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You may address me as the Count Von Kramm, a Bohemian nobleman.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: I understand that this gentleman, your friend, is a man of honour

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: and discretion, whom I may trust with a matter of the most

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: extreme importance. If not, I should much prefer to communicate

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: with you alone."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: I rose to go, but Holmes caught me by the wrist and pushed me

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: back into my chair. "It is both, or none," said he. "You may say

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: before this gentleman anything which you may say to me."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: The Count shrugged his broad shoulders. "Then I must begin," said

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: he, "by binding you both to absolute secrecy for two years; at

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the end of that time the matter will be of no importance. At

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: present it is not too much to say that it is of such weight it

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: may have an influence upon European history."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I promise," said Holmes.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And I."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You will excuse this mask," continued our strange visitor. "The

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: august person who employs me wishes his agent to be unknown to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: you, and I may confess at once that the title by which I have

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: just called myself is not exactly my own."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I was aware of it," said Holmes dryly.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "The circumstances are of great delicacy, and every precaution

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: has to be taken to quench what might grow to be an immense

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: scandal and seriously compromise one of the reigning families of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Europe. To speak plainly, the matter implicates the great House

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: of Ormstein, hereditary kings of Bohemia."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I was also aware of that," murmured Holmes, settling himself

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: down in his armchair and closing his eyes.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Our visitor glanced with some apparent surprise at the languid,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: lounging figure of the man who had been no doubt depicted to him

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: as the most incisive reasoner and most energetic agent in Europe.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Holmes slowly reopened his eyes and looked impatiently at his

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: gigantic client.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "If your Majesty would condescend to state your case," he

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: remarked, "I should be better able to advise you."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: The man sprang from his chair and paced up and down the room in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: uncontrollable agitation. Then, with a gesture of desperation, he

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: tore the mask from his face and hurled it upon the ground. "You

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: are right," he cried; "I am the King. Why should I attempt to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: conceal it?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Why, indeed?" murmured Holmes. "Your Majesty had not spoken

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: before I was aware that I was addressing Wilhelm Gottsreich

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Sigismond von Ormstein, Grand Duke of Cassel-Felstein, and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: hereditary King of Bohemia."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "But you can understand," said our strange visitor, sitting down

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: once more and passing his hand over his high white forehead, "you

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: can understand that I am not accustomed to doing such business in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: my own person. Yet the matter was so delicate that I could not

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: confide it to an agent without putting myself in his power. I

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: have come incognito from Prague for the purpose of consulting

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: you."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then, pray consult," said Holmes, shutting his eyes once more.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "The facts are briefly these: Some five years ago, during a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: lengthy visit to Warsaw, I made the acquaintance of the well-known

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: adventuress, Irene Adler. The name is no doubt familiar to you."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Kindly look her up in my index, Doctor," murmured Holmes without

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: opening his eyes. For many years he had adopted a system of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: docketing all paragraphs concerning men and things, so that it

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: was difficult to name a subject or a person on which he could not

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: at once furnish information. In this case I found her biography

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: sandwiched in between that of a Hebrew rabbi and that of a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: staff-commander who had written a monograph upon the deep-sea

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: fishes.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Let me see!" said Holmes. "Hum! Born in New Jersey in the year

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: 1858. Contralto--hum! La Scala, hum! Prima donna Imperial Opera

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: of Warsaw--yes! Retired from operatic stage--ha! Living in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: London--quite so! Your Majesty, as I understand, became entangled

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: with this young person, wrote her some compromising letters, and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: is now desirous of getting those letters back."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Precisely so. But how--"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Was there a secret marriage?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "None."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "No legal papers or certificates?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "None."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then I fail to follow your Majesty. If this young person should

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: produce her letters for blackmailing or other purposes, how is

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: she to prove their authenticity?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "There is the writing."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Pooh, pooh! Forgery."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "My private note-paper."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Stolen."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "My own seal."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Imitated."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "My photograph."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Bought."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "We were both in the photograph."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Oh, dear! That is very bad! Your Majesty has indeed committed an

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: indiscretion."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I was mad--insane."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You have compromised yourself seriously."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I was only Crown Prince then. I was young. I am but thirty now."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "It must be recovered."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "We have tried and failed."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Your Majesty must pay. It must be bought."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "She will not sell."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Stolen, then."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Five attempts have been made. Twice burglars in my pay ransacked

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: her house. Once we diverted her luggage when she travelled. Twice

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: she has been waylaid. There has been no result."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "No sign of it?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Absolutely none."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Holmes laughed. "It is quite a pretty little problem," said he.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "But a very serious one to me," returned the King reproachfully.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Very, indeed. And what does she propose to do with the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: photograph?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "To ruin me."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "But how?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I am about to be married."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "So I have heard."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "To Clotilde Lothman von Saxe-Meningen, second daughter of the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: King of Scandinavia. You may know the strict principles of her

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: family. She is herself the very soul of delicacy. A shadow of a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: doubt as to my conduct would bring the matter to an end."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And Irene Adler?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Threatens to send them the photograph. And she will do it. I

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: know that she will do it. You do not know her, but she has a soul

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: of steel. She has the face of the most beautiful of women, and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the mind of the most resolute of men. Rather than I should marry

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: another woman, there are no lengths to which she would not

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: go--none."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You are sure that she has not sent it yet?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I am sure."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And why?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Because she has said that she would send it on the day when the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: betrothal was publicly proclaimed. That will be next Monday."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Oh, then we have three days yet," said Holmes with a yawn. "That

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: is very fortunate, as I have one or two matters of importance to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: look into just at present. Your Majesty will, of course, stay in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: London for the present?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Certainly. You will find me at the Langham under the name of the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Count Von Kramm."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then I shall drop you a line to let you know how we progress."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Pray do so. I shall be all anxiety."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then, as to money?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You have carte blanche."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Absolutely?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I tell you that I would give one of the provinces of my kingdom

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to have that photograph."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And for present expenses?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: The King took a heavy chamois leather bag from under his cloak

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: and laid it on the table.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "There are three hundred pounds in gold and seven hundred in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: notes," he said.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Holmes scribbled a receipt upon a sheet of his note-book and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: handed it to him.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And Mademoiselle's address?" he asked.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Is Briony Lodge, Serpentine Avenue, St. John's Wood."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Holmes took a note of it. "One other question," said he. "Was the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: photograph a cabinet?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "It was."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then, good-night, your Majesty, and I trust that we shall soon

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: have some good news for you. And good-night, Watson," he added,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: as the wheels of the royal brougham rolled down the street. "If

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: you will be good enough to call to-morrow afternoon at three

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: o'clock I should like to chat this little matter over with you."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: II.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: At three o'clock precisely I was at Baker Street, but Holmes had

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: not yet returned. The landlady informed me that he had left the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: house shortly after eight o'clock in the morning. I sat down

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: beside the fire, however, with the intention of awaiting him,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: however long he might be. I was already deeply interested in his

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: inquiry, for, though it was surrounded by none of the grim and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: strange features which were associated with the two crimes which

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: I have already recorded, still, the nature of the case and the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: exalted station of his client gave it a character of its own.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Indeed, apart from the nature of the investigation which my

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: friend had on hand, there was something in his masterly grasp of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: a situation, and his keen, incisive reasoning, which made it a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: pleasure to me to study his system of work, and to follow the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: quick, subtle methods by which he disentangled the most

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: inextricable mysteries. So accustomed was I to his invariable

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: success that the very possibility of his failing had ceased to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: enter into my head.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: It was close upon four before the door opened, and a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: drunken-looking groom, ill-kempt and side-whiskered, with an

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: inflamed face and disreputable clothes, walked into the room.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Accustomed as I was to my friend's amazing powers in the use of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: disguises, I had to look three times before I was certain that it

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: was indeed he. With a nod he vanished into the bedroom, whence he

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: emerged in five minutes tweed-suited and respectable, as of old.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Putting his hands into his pockets, he stretched out his legs in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: front of the fire and laughed heartily for some minutes.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I can't imagine. I suppose that you have been watching the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: habits, and perhaps the house, of Miss Irene Adler."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Quite so; but the sequel was rather unusual. I will tell you,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: however. I left the house a little after eight o'clock this

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: morning in the character of a groom out of work. There is a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: wonderful sympathy and freemasonry among horsey men. Be one of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: them, and you will know all that there is to know. I soon found

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Briony Lodge. It is a bijou villa, with a garden at the back, but

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: built out in front right up to the road, two stories. Chubb lock

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to the door. Large sitting-room on the right side, well

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: furnished, with long windows almost to the floor, and those

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: preposterous English window fasteners which a child could open.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Behind there was nothing remarkable, save that the passage window

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: could be reached from the top of the coach-house. I walked round

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: it and examined it closely from every point of view, but without

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: noting anything else of interest.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I then lounged down the street and found, as I expected, that

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: there was a mews in a lane which runs down by one wall of the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: garden. I lent the ostlers a hand in rubbing down their horses,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: and received in exchange twopence, a glass of half and half, two

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: fills of shag tobacco, and as much information as I could desire

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: about Miss Adler, to say nothing of half a dozen other people in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the neighbourhood in whom I was not in the least interested, but

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: whose biographies I was compelled to listen to."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And what of Irene Adler?" I asked.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Oh, she has turned all the men's heads down in that part. She is

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the daintiest thing under a bonnet on this planet. So say the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Serpentine-mews, to a man. She lives quietly, sings at concerts,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: drives out at five every day, and returns at seven sharp for

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: dinner. Seldom goes out at other times, except when she sings.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Has only one male visitor, but a good deal of him. He is dark,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: handsome, and dashing, never calls less than once a day, and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: often twice. He is a Mr. Godfrey Norton, of the Inner Temple. See

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the advantages of a cabman as a confidant. They had driven him

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: home a dozen times from Serpentine-mews, and knew all about him.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: When I had listened to all they had to tell, I began to walk up

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: and down near Briony Lodge once more, and to think over my plan

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: of campaign.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "This Godfrey Norton was evidently an important factor in the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: matter. He was a lawyer. That sounded ominous. What was the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: relation between them, and what the object of his repeated

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: visits? Was she his client, his friend, or his mistress? If the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: former, she had probably transferred the photograph to his

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: keeping. If the latter, it was less likely. On the issue of this

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: question depended whether I should continue my work at Briony

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Lodge, or turn my attention to the gentleman's chambers in the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Temple. It was a delicate point, and it widened the field of my

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: inquiry. I fear that I bore you with these details, but I have to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: let you see my little difficulties, if you are to understand the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: situation."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I am following you closely," I answered.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "I was still balancing the matter in my mind when a hansom cab

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: drove up to Briony Lodge, and a gentleman sprang out. He was a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: remarkably handsome man, dark, aquiline, and moustached--evidently

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the man of whom I had heard. He appeared to be in a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: great hurry, shouted to the cabman to wait, and brushed past the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: maid who opened the door with the air of a man who was thoroughly

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: at home.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: "He was in the house about half an hour, and I could catch

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: glimpses of him in the windows of the sitting-room, pacing up and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: nothing. Presently he emerged, looking even more flurried than

text: before. As he stepped up to the cab, he pulled a gold watch from

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

text: remarkably animated. There was a group of shabbily dressed men

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: smoking and laughing in a corner, a scissors-grinder with his

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: wheel, two guardsmen who were flirting with a nurse-girl, and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: several well-dressed young men who were lounging up and down with

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: cigars in their mouths.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You see," remarked Holmes, as we paced to and fro in front of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the house, "this marriage rather simplifies matters. The

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: photograph becomes a double-edged weapon now. The chances are

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: that she would be as averse to its being seen by Mr. Godfrey

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Norton, as our client is to its coming to the eyes of his

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: princess. Now the question is, Where are we to find the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: photograph?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Where, indeed?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "It is most unlikely that she carries it about with her. It is

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: cabinet size. Too large for easy concealment about a woman's

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: dress. She knows that the King is capable of having her waylaid

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: and searched. Two attempts of the sort have already been made. We

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: may take it, then, that she does not carry it about with her."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Where, then?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Her banker or her lawyer. There is that double possibility. But

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: I am inclined to think neither. Women are naturally secretive,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: and they like to do their own secreting. Why should she hand it

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: over to anyone else? She could trust her own guardianship, but

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: she could not tell what indirect or political influence might be

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: brought to bear upon a business man. Besides, remember that she

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: had resolved to use it within a few days. It must be where she

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: can lay her hands upon it. It must be in her own house."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "But it has twice been burgled."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Pshaw! They did not know how to look."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "But how will you look?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I will not look."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "What then?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I will get her to show me."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "But she will refuse."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "She will not be able to. But I hear the rumble of wheels. It is

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: her carriage. Now carry out my orders to the letter."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: As he spoke the gleam of the side-lights of a carriage came round

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the curve of the avenue. It was a smart little landau which

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: rattled up to the door of Briony Lodge. As it pulled up, one of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the loafing men at the corner dashed forward to open the door in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the hope of earning a copper, but was elbowed away by another

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: loafer, who had rushed up with the same intention. A fierce

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: quarrel broke out, which was increased by the two guardsmen, who

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: took sides with one of the loungers, and by the scissors-grinder,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: who was equally hot upon the other side. A blow was struck, and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: in an instant the lady, who had stepped from her carriage, was

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the centre of a little knot of flushed and struggling men, who

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: struck savagely at each other with their fists and sticks. Holmes

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: dashed into the crowd to protect the lady; but just as he reached

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: her he gave a cry and dropped to the ground, with the blood

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: running freely down his face. At his fall the guardsmen took to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: their heels in one direction and the loungers in the other, while

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: a number of better-dressed people, who had watched the scuffle

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: without taking part in it, crowded in to help the lady and to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: attend to the injured man. Irene Adler, as I will still call her,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: had hurried up the steps; but she stood at the top with her

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: superb figure outlined against the lights of the hall, looking

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: back into the street.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Is the poor gentleman much hurt?" she asked.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "He is dead," cried several voices.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "No, no, there's life in him!" shouted another. "But he'll be

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: gone before you can get him to hospital."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "He's a brave fellow," said a woman. "They would have had the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: lady's purse and watch if it hadn't been for him. They were a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: gang, and a rough one, too. Ah, he's breathing now."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "He can't lie in the street. May we bring him in, marm?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Surely. Bring him into the sitting-room. There is a comfortable

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: sofa. This way, please!"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Slowly and solemnly he was borne into Briony Lodge and laid out

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: in the principal room, while I still observed the proceedings

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: from my post by the window. The lamps had been lit, but the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: blinds had not been drawn, so that I could see Holmes as he lay

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: upon the couch. I do not know whether he was seized with

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: compunction at that moment for the part he was playing, but I

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: know that I never felt more heartily ashamed of myself in my life

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: than when I saw the beautiful creature against whom I was

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: conspiring, or the grace and kindliness with which she waited

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: upon the injured man. And yet it would be the blackest treachery

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to Holmes to draw back now from the part which he had intrusted

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to me. I hardened my heart, and took the smoke-rocket from under

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: my ulster. After all, I thought, we are not injuring her. We are

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: but preventing her from injuring another.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Holmes had sat up upon the couch, and I saw him motion like a man

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: who is in need of air. A maid rushed across and threw open the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: window. At the same instant I saw him raise his hand and at the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: signal I tossed my rocket into the room with a cry of "Fire!" The

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: word was no sooner out of my mouth than the whole crowd of

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: spectators, well dressed and ill--gentlemen, ostlers, and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: servant-maids--joined in a general shriek of "Fire!" Thick clouds

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: of smoke curled through the room and out at the open window. I

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: caught a glimpse of rushing figures, and a moment later the voice

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: of Holmes from within assuring them that it was a false alarm.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Slipping through the shouting crowd I made my way to the corner

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: of the street, and in ten minutes was rejoiced to find my

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: friend's arm in mine, and to get away from the scene of uproar.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: He walked swiftly and in silence for some few minutes until we

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: had turned down one of the quiet streets which lead towards the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Edgeware Road.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You did it very nicely, Doctor," he remarked. "Nothing could

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: have been better. It is all right."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You have the photograph?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I know where it is."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And how did you find out?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "She showed me, as I told you she would."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I am still in the dark."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I do not wish to make a mystery," said he, laughing. "The matter

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: was perfectly simple. You, of course, saw that everyone in the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: street was an accomplice. They were all engaged for the evening."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I guessed as much."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then, when the row broke out, I had a little moist red paint in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the palm of my hand. I rushed forward, fell down, clapped my hand

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to my face, and became a piteous spectacle. It is an old trick."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "That also I could fathom."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then they carried me in. She was bound to have me in. What else

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: could she do? And into her sitting-room, which was the very room

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: which I suspected. It lay between that and her bedroom, and I was

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: determined to see which. They laid me on a couch, I motioned for

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: air, they were compelled to open the window, and you had your

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: chance."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "How did that help you?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "It was all-important. When a woman thinks that her house is on

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: fire, her instinct is at once to rush to the thing which she

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: values most. It is a perfectly overpowering impulse, and I have

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: more than once taken advantage of it. In the case of the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Darlington substitution scandal it was of use to me, and also in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the Arnsworth Castle business. A married woman grabs at her baby;

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: an unmarried one reaches for her jewel-box. Now it was clear to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: me that our lady of to-day had nothing in the house more precious

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to her than what we are in quest of. She would rush to secure it.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: The alarm of fire was admirably done. The smoke and shouting were

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: enough to shake nerves of steel. She responded beautifully. The

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: photograph is in a recess behind a sliding panel just above the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: right bell-pull. She was there in an instant, and I caught a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: glimpse of it as she half-drew it out. When I cried out that it

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: was a false alarm, she replaced it, glanced at the rocket, rushed

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: from the room, and I have not seen her since. I rose, and, making

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: my excuses, escaped from the house. I hesitated whether to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: attempt to secure the photograph at once; but the coachman had

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: come in, and as he was watching me narrowly it seemed safer to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: wait. A little over-precipitance may ruin all."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And now?" I asked.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Our quest is practically finished. I shall call with the King

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to-morrow, and with you, if you care to come with us. We will be

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: shown into the sitting-room to wait for the lady, but it is

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: probable that when she comes she may find neither us nor the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: photograph. It might be a satisfaction to his Majesty to regain

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: it with his own hands."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And when will you call?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "At eight in the morning. She will not be up, so that we shall

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: have a clear field. Besides, we must be prompt, for this marriage

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: may mean a complete change in her life and habits. I must wire to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: the King without delay."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: We had reached Baker Street and had stopped at the door. He was

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: searching his pockets for the key when someone passing said:

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Good-night, Mister Sherlock Holmes."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: There were several people on the pavement at the time, but the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: greeting appeared to come from a slim youth in an ulster who had

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: hurried by.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I've heard that voice before," said Holmes, staring down the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: dimly lit street. "Now, I wonder who the deuce that could have

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: been."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: III.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: I slept at Baker Street that night, and we were engaged upon our

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: toast and coffee in the morning when the King of Bohemia rushed

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: into the room.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You have really got it!" he cried, grasping Sherlock Holmes by

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: either shoulder and looking eagerly into his face.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Not yet."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "But you have hopes?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I have hopes."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then, come. I am all impatience to be gone."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "We must have a cab."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "No, my brougham is waiting."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Then that will simplify matters." We descended and started off

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: once more for Briony Lodge.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Irene Adler is married," remarked Holmes.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Married! When?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Yesterday."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "But to whom?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "To an English lawyer named Norton."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "But she could not love him."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I am in hopes that she does."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And why in hopes?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Because it would spare your Majesty all fear of future

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: annoyance. If the lady loves her husband, she does not love your

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Majesty. If she does not love your Majesty, there is no reason

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: why she should interfere with your Majesty's plan."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "It is true. And yet--Well! I wish she had been of my own

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: station! What a queen she would have made!" He relapsed into a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: moody silence, which was not broken until we drew up in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Serpentine Avenue.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: The door of Briony Lodge was open, and an elderly woman stood

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: upon the steps. She watched us with a sardonic eye as we stepped

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: from the brougham.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Mr. Sherlock Holmes, I believe?" said she.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I am Mr. Holmes," answered my companion, looking at her with a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: questioning and rather startled gaze.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Indeed! My mistress told me that you were likely to call. She

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: left this morning with her husband by the 5:15 train from Charing

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Cross for the Continent."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "What!" Sherlock Holmes staggered back, white with chagrin and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: surprise. "Do you mean that she has left England?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Never to return."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "And the papers?" asked the King hoarsely. "All is lost."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "We shall see." He pushed past the servant and rushed into the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: drawing-room, followed by the King and myself. The furniture was

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: scattered about in every direction, with dismantled shelves and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: open drawers, as if the lady had hurriedly ransacked them before

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: her flight. Holmes rushed at the bell-pull, tore back a small

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: sliding shutter, and, plunging in his hand, pulled out a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: photograph and a letter. The photograph was of Irene Adler

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: herself in evening dress, the letter was superscribed to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Sherlock Holmes, Esq. To be left till called for." My friend

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: tore it open and we all three read it together. It was dated at

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: midnight of the preceding night and ran in this way:

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "MY DEAR MR. SHERLOCK HOLMES,--You really did it very well. You

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: took me in completely. Until after the alarm of fire, I had not a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: suspicion. But then, when I found how I had betrayed myself, I

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: began to think. I had been warned against you months ago. I had

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: been told that if the King employed an agent it would certainly

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: be you. And your address had been given me. Yet, with all this,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: you made me reveal what you wanted to know. Even after I became

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: suspicious, I found it hard to think evil of such a dear, kind

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: old clergyman. But, you know, I have been trained as an actress

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: myself. Male costume is nothing new to me. I often take advantage

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: of the freedom which it gives. I sent John, the coachman, to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: watch you, ran up stairs, got into my walking-clothes, as I call

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: them, and came down just as you departed.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Well, I followed you to your door, and so made sure that I was

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: really an object of interest to the celebrated Mr. Sherlock

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Holmes. Then I, rather imprudently, wished you good-night, and

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: started for the Temple to see my husband.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "We both thought the best resource was flight, when pursued by

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: so formidable an antagonist; so you will find the nest empty when

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: you call to-morrow. As to the photograph, your client may rest in

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: peace. I love and am loved by a better man than he. The King may

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: do what he will without hindrance from one whom he has cruelly

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: wronged. I keep it only to safeguard myself, and to preserve a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: weapon which will always secure me from any steps which he might

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: take in the future. I leave a photograph which he might care to

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: possess; and I remain, dear Mr. Sherlock Holmes,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Very truly yours,

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "IRENE NORTON, nee ADLER."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "What a woman--oh, what a woman!" cried the King of Bohemia, when

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: we had all three read this epistle. "Did I not tell you how quick

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: and resolute she was? Would she not have made an admirable queen?

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: Is it not a pity that she was not on my level?"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "From what I have seen of the lady she seems indeed to be on a

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: very different level to your Majesty," said Holmes coldly. "I am

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: sorry that I have not been able to bring your Majesty's business

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: to a more successful conclusion."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "On the contrary, my dear sir," cried the King; "nothing could be

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: more successful. I know that her word is inviolate. The

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: photograph is now as safe as if it were in the fire."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I am glad to hear your Majesty say so."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I am immensely indebted to you. Pray tell me in what way I can

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: reward you. This ring--" He slipped an emerald snake ring from

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: his finger and held it out upon the palm of his hand.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Your Majesty has something which I should value even more

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: highly," said Holmes.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "You have but to name it."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "This photograph!"

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: The King stared at him in amazement.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "Irene's photograph!" he cried. "Certainly, if you wish it."

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: "I thank your Majesty. Then there is no more to be done in the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: matter. I have the honour to wish you a very good-morning." He

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: bowed, and, turning away without observing the hand which the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: King had stretched out to him, he set off in my company for his

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: chambers.

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: And that was how a great scandal threatened to affect the kingdom

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: of Bohemia, and how the best plans of Mr. Sherlock Holmes were

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: beaten by a woman's wit. He used to make merry over the

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: cleverness of women, but I have not heard him do it of late. And

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: when he speaks of Irene Adler, or when he refers to her

story: ADVENTURE I. A SCANDAL IN BOHEMIA
text: photograph, it is always under the honourable title of the woman.

text: ADVENTURE II. THE RED-HEADED LEAGUE
