story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: I walked down to the station with them, and then wandered through

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the streets of the little town, finally returning to the hotel,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: where I lay upon the sofa and tried to interest myself in a

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: yellow-backed novel. The puny plot of the story was so thin,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: however, when compared to the deep mystery through which we were

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: groping, and I found my attention wander so continually from the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: action to the fact, that I at last flung it across the room and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: gave myself up entirely to a consideration of the events of the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: day. Supposing that this unhappy young man's story were

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: absolutely true, then what hellish thing, what absolutely

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: unforeseen and extraordinary calamity could have occurred between

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the time when he parted from his father, and the moment when,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: drawn back by his screams, he rushed into the glade? It was

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: something terrible and deadly. What could it be? Might not the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: nature of the injuries reveal something to my medical instincts?

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: I rang the bell and called for the weekly county paper, which

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: contained a verbatim account of the inquest. In the surgeon's

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: deposition it was stated that the posterior third of the left

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: parietal bone and the left half of the occipital bone had been

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: shattered by a heavy blow from a blunt weapon. I marked the spot

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: upon my own head. Clearly such a blow must have been struck from

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: behind. That was to some extent in favour of the accused, as when

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: seen quarrelling he was face to face with his father. Still, it

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: did not go for very much, for the older man might have turned his

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: back before the blow fell. Still, it might be worth while to call

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Holmes' attention to it. Then there was the peculiar dying

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: reference to a rat. What could that mean? It could not be

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: delirium. A man dying from a sudden blow does not commonly become

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: delirious. No, it was more likely to be an attempt to explain how

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: he met his fate. But what could it indicate? I cudgelled my

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: brains to find some possible explanation. And then the incident

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: of the grey cloth seen by young McCarthy. If that were true the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: murderer must have dropped some part of his dress, presumably his

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: overcoat, in his flight, and must have had the hardihood to

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: kneeling with his back turned not a dozen paces off. What a

text: did not wonder at Lestrade's opinion, and yet I had so much faith

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: as every fresh fact seemed to strengthen his conviction of young

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: It was late before Sherlock Holmes returned. He came back alone,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: for Lestrade was staying in lodgings in the town.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "The glass still keeps very high," he remarked as he sat down.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "It is of importance that it should not rain before we are able

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: to go over the ground. On the other hand, a man should be at his

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: very best and keenest for such nice work as that, and I did not

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: wish to do it when fagged by a long journey. I have seen young

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: McCarthy."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "And what did you learn from him?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Nothing."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Could he throw no light?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "None at all. I was inclined to think at one time that he knew

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: who had done it and was screening him or her, but I am convinced

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: now that he is as puzzled as everyone else. He is not a very

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: quick-witted youth, though comely to look at and, I should think,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: sound at heart."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "I cannot admire his taste," I remarked, "if it is indeed a fact

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: that he was averse to a marriage with so charming a young lady as

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: this Miss Turner."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Ah, thereby hangs a rather painful tale. This fellow is madly,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: insanely, in love with her, but some two years ago, when he was

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: only a lad, and before he really knew her, for she had been away

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: five years at a boarding-school, what does the idiot do but get

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: into the clutches of a barmaid in Bristol and marry her at a

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: registry office? No one knows a word of the matter, but you can

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: imagine how maddening it must be to him to be upbraided for not

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: doing what he would give his very eyes to do, but what he knows

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: to be absolutely impossible. It was sheer frenzy of this sort

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: which made him throw his hands up into the air when his father,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: at their last interview, was goading him on to propose to Miss

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Turner. On the other hand, he had no means of supporting himself,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: and his father, who was by all accounts a very hard man, would

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: have thrown him over utterly had he known the truth. It was with

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: his barmaid wife that he had spent the last three days in

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Bristol, and his father did not know where he was. Mark that

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: point. It is of importance. Good has come out of evil, however,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: for the barmaid, finding from the papers that he is in serious

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: trouble and likely to be hanged, has thrown him over utterly and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: has written to him to say that she has a husband already in the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Bermuda Dockyard, so that there is really no tie between them. I

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: think that that bit of news has consoled young McCarthy for all

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: that he has suffered."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "But if he is innocent, who has done it?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Ah! who? I would call your attention very particularly to two

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: points. One is that the murdered man had an appointment with

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: someone at the pool, and that the someone could not have been his

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: son, for his son was away, and he did not know when he would

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: return. The second is that the murdered man was heard to cry

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: 'Cooee!' before he knew that his son had returned. Those are the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: crucial points upon which the case depends. And now let us talk

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: about George Meredith, if you please, and we shall leave all

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: minor matters until to-morrow."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: There was no rain, as Holmes had foretold, and the morning broke

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: bright and cloudless. At nine o'clock Lestrade called for us with

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the carriage, and we set off for Hatherley Farm and the Boscombe

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Pool.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "There is serious news this morning," Lestrade observed. "It is

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: said that Mr. Turner, of the Hall, is so ill that his life is

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: despaired of."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "An elderly man, I presume?" said Holmes.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "About sixty; but his constitution has been shattered by his life

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: abroad, and he has been in failing health for some time. This

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: business has had a very bad effect upon him. He was an old friend

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: of McCarthy's, and, I may add, a great benefactor to him, for I

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: have learned that he gave him Hatherley Farm rent free."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Indeed! That is interesting," said Holmes.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Oh, yes! In a hundred other ways he has helped him. Everybody

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: about here speaks of his kindness to him."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Really! Does it not strike you as a little singular that this

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: McCarthy, who appears to have had little of his own, and to have

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: been under such obligations to Turner, should still talk of

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: marrying his son to Turner's daughter, who is, presumably,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: heiress to the estate, and that in such a very cocksure manner,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: as if it were merely a case of a proposal and all else would

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: follow? It is the more strange, since we know that Turner himself

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: was averse to the idea. The daughter told us as much. Do you not

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: deduce something from that?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "We have got to the deductions and the inferences," said

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Lestrade, winking at me. "I find it hard enough to tackle facts,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "You are right," said Holmes demurely; "you do find it very hard

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: to tackle the facts."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Anyhow, I have grasped one fact which you seem to find it

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "And that is--"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

text: "That McCarthy senior met his death from McCarthy junior and that

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Well, moonshine is a brighter thing than fog," said Holmes,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: laughing. "But I am very much mistaken if this is not Hatherley

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Yes, that is it." It was a widespread, comfortable-looking

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: building, two-storied, slate-roofed, with great yellow blotches

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: when the maid, at Holmes' request, showed us the boots which her

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: desired to be led to the court-yard, from which we all followed

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: Sherlock Holmes was transformed when he was hot upon such a scent

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: as this. Men who had only known the quiet thinker and logician of

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: and darkened. His brows were drawn into two hard black lines,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: while his eyes shone out from beneath them with a steely glitter.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: His face was bent downward, his shoulders bowed, his lips

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: compressed, and the veins stood out like whipcord in his long,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: sinewy neck. His nostrils seemed to dilate with a purely animal

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: lust for the chase, and his mind was so absolutely concentrated

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: upon the matter before him that a question or remark fell

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: unheeded upon his ears, or, at the most, only provoked a quick,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: along the track which ran through the meadows, and so by way of

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the path and amid the short grass which bounded it on either

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: side. Sometimes Holmes would hurry on, sometimes stop dead, and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: while I watched my friend with the interest which sprang from the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: conviction that every one of his actions was directed towards a

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: The Boscombe Pool, which is a little reed-girt sheet of water

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: some fifty yards across, is situated at the boundary between the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Hatherley Farm and the private park of the wealthy Mr. Turner.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Above the woods which lined it upon the farther side we could see

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the red, jutting pinnacles which marked the site of the rich

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: landowner's dwelling. On the Hatherley side of the pool the woods

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: grew very thick, and there was a narrow belt of sodden grass

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: twenty paces across between the edge of the trees and the reeds

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: which lined the lake. Lestrade showed us the exact spot at which

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the body had been found, and, indeed, so moist was the ground,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: that I could plainly see the traces which had been left by the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: fall of the stricken man. To Holmes, as I could see by his eager

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: face and peering eyes, very many other things were to be read

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: upon the trampled grass. He ran round, like a dog who is picking

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: up a scent, and then turned upon my companion.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "What did you go into the pool for?" he asked.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "I fished about with a rake. I thought there might be some weapon

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

text: "Oh, tut, tut! I have no time! That left foot of yours with its

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: inward twist is all over the place. A mole could trace it, and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: have been had I been here before they came like a herd of buffalo

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: and wallowed all over it. Here is where the party with the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: lodge-keeper came, and they have covered all tracks for six or

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: eight feet round the body. But here are three separate tracks of

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the same feet." He drew out a lens and lay down upon his

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: waterproof to have a better view, talking all the time rather to

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: himself than to us. "These are young McCarthy's feet. Twice he

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: was walking, and once he ran swiftly, so that the soles are

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: deeply marked and the heels hardly visible. That bears out his

text: Ha, ha! What have we here? Tiptoes! tiptoes! Square, too, quite

text: "Is a tall man, left-handed, limps with the right leg, wears

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: thick-soled shooting-boots and a grey cloak, smokes Indian

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: cigars, uses a cigar-holder, and carries a blunt pen-knife in his

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: pocket. There are several other indications, but these may be

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: enough to aid us in our search."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Lestrade laughed. "I am afraid that I am still a sceptic," he

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: said. "Theories are all very well, but we have to deal with a

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: hard-headed British jury."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Nous verrons," answered Holmes calmly. "You work your own

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: method, and I shall work mine. I shall be busy this afternoon,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: and shall probably return to London by the evening train."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "And leave your case unfinished?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "No, finished."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "But the mystery?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "It is solved."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Who was the criminal, then?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "The gentleman I describe."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "But who is he?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Surely it would not be difficult to find out. This is not such a

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: populous neighbourhood."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Lestrade shrugged his shoulders. "I am a practical man," he said,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "and I really cannot undertake to go about the country looking

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: for a left-handed gentleman with a game leg. I should become the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: laughing-stock of Scotland Yard."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "All right," said Holmes quietly. "I have given you the chance.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Here are your lodgings. Good-bye. I shall drop you a line before

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: I leave."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Having left Lestrade at his rooms, we drove to our hotel, where

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: we found lunch upon the table. Holmes was silent and buried in

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: thought with a pained expression upon his face, as one who finds

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: himself in a perplexing position.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Look here, Watson," he said when the cloth was cleared "just sit

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: down in this chair and let me preach to you for a little. I don't

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: know quite what to do, and I should value your advice. Light a

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: cigar and let me expound."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Pray do so."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Well, now, in considering this case there are two points about

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: young McCarthy's narrative which struck us both instantly,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: although they impressed me in his favour and you against him. One

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: was the fact that his father should, according to his account,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: cry 'Cooee!' before seeing him. The other was his singular dying

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: reference to a rat. He mumbled several words, you understand, but

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: that was all that caught the son's ear. Now from this double

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: point our research must commence, and we will begin it by

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: presuming that what the lad says is absolutely true."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "What of this 'Cooee!' then?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Well, obviously it could not have been meant for the son. The

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: son, as far as he knew, was in Bristol. It was mere chance that

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: he was within earshot. The 'Cooee!' was meant to attract the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: attention of whoever it was that he had the appointment with. But

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: 'Cooee' is a distinctly Australian cry, and one which is used

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: between Australians. There is a strong presumption that the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: person whom McCarthy expected to meet him at Boscombe Pool was

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: someone who had been in Australia."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "What of the rat, then?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Sherlock Holmes took a folded paper from his pocket and flattened

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: it out on the table. "This is a map of the Colony of Victoria,"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: he said. "I wired to Bristol for it last night." He put his hand

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: over part of the map. "What do you read?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "ARAT," I read.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "And now?" He raised his hand.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "BALLARAT."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Quite so. That was the word the man uttered, and of which his

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: son only caught the last two syllables. He was trying to utter

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the name of his murderer. So and so, of Ballarat."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "It is wonderful!" I exclaimed.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "It is obvious. And now, you see, I had narrowed the field down

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: considerably. The possession of a grey garment was a third point

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: which, granting the son's statement to be correct, was a

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: certainty. We have come now out of mere vagueness to the definite

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: conception of an Australian from Ballarat with a grey cloak."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Certainly."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "And one who was at home in the district, for the pool can only

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: be approached by the farm or by the estate, where strangers could

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: hardly wander."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Quite so."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Then comes our expedition of to-day. By an examination of the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: ground I gained the trifling details which I gave to that

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: imbecile Lestrade, as to the personality of the criminal."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "But how did you gain them?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "You know my method. It is founded upon the observation of

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: trifles."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "His height I know that you might roughly judge from the length

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: of his stride. His boots, too, might be told from their traces."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Yes, they were peculiar boots."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "But his lameness?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "The impression of his right foot was always less distinct than

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: his left. He put less weight upon it. Why? Because he limped--he

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: was lame."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "But his left-handedness."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "You were yourself struck by the nature of the injury as recorded

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: by the surgeon at the inquest. The blow was struck from

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: immediately behind, and yet was upon the left side. Now, how can

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: that be unless it were by a left-handed man? He had stood behind

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: that tree during the interview between the father and son. He had

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: even smoked there. I found the ash of a cigar, which my special

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: knowledge of tobacco ashes enables me to pronounce as an Indian

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: cigar. I have, as you know, devoted some attention to this, and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: written a little monograph on the ashes of 140 different

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: varieties of pipe, cigar, and cigarette tobacco. Having found the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: ash, I then looked round and discovered the stump among the moss

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: where he had tossed it. It was an Indian cigar, of the variety

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: which are rolled in Rotterdam."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "And the cigar-holder?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "I could see that the end had not been in his mouth. Therefore he

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: used a holder. The tip had been cut off, not bitten off, but the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: cut was not a clean one, so I deduced a blunt pen-knife."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Holmes," I said, "you have drawn a net round this man from which

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: he cannot escape, and you have saved an innocent human life as

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: truly as if you had cut the cord which was hanging him. I see the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: direction in which all this points. The culprit is--"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Mr. John Turner," cried the hotel waiter, opening the door of

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: our sitting-room, and ushering in a visitor.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: The man who entered was a strange and impressive figure. His

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: slow, limping step and bowed shoulders gave the appearance of

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: decrepitude, and yet his hard, deep-lined, craggy features, and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: his enormous limbs showed that he was possessed of unusual

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: strength of body and of character. His tangled beard, grizzled

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: hair, and outstanding, drooping eyebrows combined to give an air

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: of dignity and power to his appearance, but his face was of an

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: ashen white, while his lips and the corners of his nostrils were

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: tinged with a shade of blue. It was clear to me at a glance that

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: he was in the grip of some deadly and chronic disease.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Pray sit down on the sofa," said Holmes gently. "You had my

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: note?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Yes, the lodge-keeper brought it up. You said that you wished to

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: see me here to avoid scandal."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "I thought people would talk if I went to the Hall."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "And why did you wish to see me?" He looked across at my

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: companion with despair in his weary eyes, as though his question

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: was already answered.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Yes," said Holmes, answering the look rather than the words. "It

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: is so. I know all about McCarthy."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: The old man sank his face in his hands. "God help me!" he cried.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "But I would not have let the young man come to harm. I give you

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: my word that I would have spoken out if it went against him at

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the Assizes."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "I am glad to hear you say so," said Holmes gravely.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "I would have spoken now had it not been for my dear girl. It

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: would break her heart--it will break her heart when she hears

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: that I am arrested."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "It may not come to that," said Holmes.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "What?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "I am no official agent. I understand that it was your daughter

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: who required my presence here, and I am acting in her interests.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Young McCarthy must be got off, however."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "I am a dying man," said old Turner. "I have had diabetes for

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: years. My doctor says it is a question whether I shall live a

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: month. Yet I would rather die under my own roof than in a gaol."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Holmes rose and sat down at the table with his pen in his hand

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: and a bundle of paper before him. "Just tell us the truth," he

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: said. "I shall jot down the facts. You will sign it, and Watson

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: here can witness it. Then I could produce your confession at the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: last extremity to save young McCarthy. I promise you that I shall

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: not use it unless it is absolutely needed."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "It's as well," said the old man; "it's a question whether I

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: shall live to the Assizes, so it matters little to me, but I

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: should wish to spare Alice the shock. And now I will make the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: thing clear to you; it has been a long time in the acting, but

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: will not take me long to tell.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "You didn't know this dead man, McCarthy. He was a devil

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: incarnate. I tell you that. God keep you out of the clutches of

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: such a man as he. His grip has been upon me these twenty years,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: and he has blasted my life. I'll tell you first how I came to be

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: in his power.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "It was in the early '60's at the diggings. I was a young chap

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: then, hot-blooded and reckless, ready to turn my hand at

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: anything; I got among bad companions, took to drink, had no luck

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: with my claim, took to the bush, and in a word became what you

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: would call over here a highway robber. There were six of us, and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: we had a wild, free life of it, sticking up a station from time

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: to time, or stopping the wagons on the road to the diggings.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Black Jack of Ballarat was the name I went under, and our party

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: is still remembered in the colony as the Ballarat Gang.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "One day a gold convoy came down from Ballarat to Melbourne, and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: we lay in wait for it and attacked it. There were six troopers

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: and six of us, so it was a close thing, but we emptied four of

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: their saddles at the first volley. Three of our boys were killed,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: however, before we got the swag. I put my pistol to the head of

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the wagon-driver, who was this very man McCarthy. I wish to the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Lord that I had shot him then, but I spared him, though I saw his

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: wicked little eyes fixed on my face, as though to remember every

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: feature. We got away with the gold, became wealthy men, and made

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: our way over to England without being suspected. There I parted

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: from my old pals and determined to settle down to a quiet and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: respectable life. I bought this estate, which chanced to be in

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the market, and I set myself to do a little good with my money,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: to make up for the way in which I had earned it. I married, too,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: and though my wife died young she left me my dear little Alice.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Even when she was just a baby her wee hand seemed to lead me down

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: the right path as nothing else had ever done. In a word, I turned

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: over a new leaf and did my best to make up for the past. All was

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: going well when McCarthy laid his grip upon me.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "I had gone up to town about an investment, and I met him in

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Regent Street with hardly a coat to his back or a boot to his

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: foot.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "'Here we are, Jack,' says he, touching me on the arm; 'we'll be

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: as good as a family to you. There's two of us, me and my son, and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: you can have the keeping of us. If you don't--it's a fine,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: law-abiding country is England, and there's always a policeman

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: within hail.'

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Well, down they came to the west country, there was no shaking

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: them off, and there they have lived rent free on my best land

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: ever since. There was no rest for me, no peace, no forgetfulness;

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: turn where I would, there was his cunning, grinning face at my

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: elbow. It grew worse as Alice grew up, for he soon saw I was more

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: afraid of her knowing my past than of the police. Whatever he

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: wanted he must have, and whatever it was I gave him without

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: question, land, money, houses, until at last he asked a thing

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: which I could not give. He asked for Alice.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "His son, you see, had grown up, and so had my girl, and as I was

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: known to be in weak health, it seemed a fine stroke to him that

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: his lad should step into the whole property. But there I was

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: firm. I would not have his cursed stock mixed with mine; not that

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: I had any dislike to the lad, but his blood was in him, and that

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: was enough. I stood firm. McCarthy threatened. I braved him to do

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: his worst. We were to meet at the pool midway between our houses

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: to talk it over.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "When I went down there I found him talking with his son, so I

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: smoked a cigar and waited behind a tree until he should be alone.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: But as I listened to his talk all that was black and bitter in

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: me seemed to come uppermost. He was urging his son to marry my

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: daughter with as little regard for what she might think as if she

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: were a slut from off the streets. It drove me mad to think that I

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: and all that I held most dear should be in the power of such a

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: man as this. Could I not snap the bond? I was already a dying and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: a desperate man. Though clear of mind and fairly strong of limb,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: I knew that my own fate was sealed. But my memory and my girl!

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Both could be saved if I could but silence that foul tongue. I

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: did it, Mr. Holmes. I would do it again. Deeply as I have sinned,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: I have led a life of martyrdom to atone for it. But that my girl

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: should be entangled in the same meshes which held me was more

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: than I could suffer. I struck him down with no more compunction

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: than if he had been some foul and venomous beast. His cry brought

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: back his son; but I had gained the cover of the wood, though I

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: was forced to go back to fetch the cloak which I had dropped in

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: my flight. That is the true story, gentlemen, of all that

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: occurred."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Well, it is not for me to judge you," said Holmes as the old man

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: signed the statement which had been drawn out. "I pray that we

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: may never be exposed to such a temptation."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "I pray not, sir. And what do you intend to do?"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "In view of your health, nothing. You are yourself aware that you

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: will soon have to answer for your deed at a higher court than the

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: Assizes. I will keep your confession, and if McCarthy is

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: condemned I shall be forced to use it. If not, it shall never be

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: seen by mortal eye; and your secret, whether you be alive or

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: dead, shall be safe with us."

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "Farewell, then," said the old man solemnly. "Your own deathbeds,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: when they come, will be the easier for the thought of the peace

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: which you have given to mine." Tottering and shaking in all his

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: giant frame, he stumbled slowly from the room.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: "God help us!" said Holmes after a long silence. "Why does fate

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: play such tricks with poor, helpless worms? I never hear of such

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: a case as this that I do not think of Baxter's words, and say,

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: 'There, but for the grace of God, goes Sherlock Holmes.'"

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: James McCarthy was acquitted at the Assizes on the strength of a

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: number of objections which had been drawn out by Holmes and

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: submitted to the defending counsel. Old Turner lived for seven

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: months after our interview, but he is now dead; and there is

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: every prospect that the son and daughter may come to live happily

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: together in ignorance of the black cloud which rests upon their

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: past.

story: ADVENTURE IV. THE BOSCOMBE VALLEY MYSTERY
text: NA
