story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "I want to test a little theory of mine," said he, pulling on his

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: boots. "I think, Watson, that you are now standing in the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: presence of one of the most absolute fools in Europe. I deserve

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: to be kicked from here to Charing Cross. But I think I have the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: key of the affair now."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "And where is it?" I asked, smiling.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "In the bathroom," he answered. "Oh, yes, I am not joking," he

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: continued, seeing my look of incredulity. "I have just been

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: there, and I have taken it out, and I have got it in this

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: Gladstone bag. Come on, my boy, and we shall see whether it will

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: not fit the lock."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: We made our way downstairs as quietly as possible, and out into

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: the bright morning sunshine. In the road stood our horse and

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: trap, with the half-clad stable-boy waiting at the head. We both

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: sprang in, and away we dashed down the London Road. A few country

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: carts were stirring, bearing in vegetables to the metropolis, but

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: the lines of villas on either side were as silent and lifeless as

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: some city in a dream.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "It has been in some points a singular case," said Holmes,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: flicking the horse on into a gallop. "I confess that I have been

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: as blind as a mole, but it is better to learn wisdom late than

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: never to learn it at all."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: In town the earliest risers were just beginning to look sleepily

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: from their windows as we drove through the streets of the Surrey

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: side. Passing down the Waterloo Bridge Road we crossed over the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: river, and dashing up Wellington Street wheeled sharply to the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: right and found ourselves in Bow Street. Sherlock Holmes was well

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: known to the force, and the two constables at the door saluted

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: him. One of them held the horse's head while the other led us in.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Who is on duty?" asked Holmes.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Inspector Bradstreet, sir."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Ah, Bradstreet, how are you?" A tall, stout official had come

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: down the stone-flagged passage, in a peaked cap and frogged

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: jacket. "I wish to have a quiet word with you, Bradstreet."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Certainly, Mr. Holmes. Step into my room here." It was a small,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: office-like room, with a huge ledger upon the table, and a

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: telephone projecting from the wall. The inspector sat down at his

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: desk.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "What can I do for you, Mr. Holmes?"

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "I called about that beggarman, Boone--the one who was charged

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: with being concerned in the disappearance of Mr. Neville St.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: Clair, of Lee."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Yes. He was brought up and remanded for further inquiries."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "So I heard. You have him here?"

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "In the cells."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Is he quiet?"

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Oh, he gives no trouble. But he is a dirty scoundrel."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Dirty?"

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Yes, it is all we can do to make him wash his hands, and his

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: face is as black as a tinker's. Well, when once his case has been

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: settled, he will have a regular prison bath; and I think, if you

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: saw him, you would agree with me that he needed it."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "I should like to see him very much."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Would you? That is easily done. Come this way. You can leave

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: your bag."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "No, I think that I'll take it."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Very good. Come this way, if you please." He led us down a

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: passage, opened a barred door, passed down a winding stair, and

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: brought us to a whitewashed corridor with a line of doors on each

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: side.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "The third on the right is his," said the inspector. "Here it

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: is!" He quietly shot back a panel in the upper part of the door

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: and glanced through.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "He is asleep," said he. "You can see him very well."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: We both put our eyes to the grating. The prisoner lay with his

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: face towards us, in a very deep sleep, breathing slowly and

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: heavily. He was a middle-sized man, coarsely clad as became his

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: calling, with a coloured shirt protruding through the rent in his

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: tattered coat. He was, as the inspector had said, extremely

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: dirty, but the grime which covered his face could not conceal its

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: repulsive ugliness. A broad wheal from an old scar ran right

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: across it from eye to chin, and by its contraction had turned up

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: one side of the upper lip, so that three teeth were exposed in a

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: perpetual snarl. A shock of very bright red hair grew low over

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: his eyes and forehead.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "He's a beauty, isn't he?" said the inspector.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "He certainly needs a wash," remarked Holmes. "I had an idea that

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: he might, and I took the liberty of bringing the tools with me."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: He opened the Gladstone bag as he spoke, and took out, to my

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: astonishment, a very large bath-sponge.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "He! he! You are a funny one," chuckled the inspector.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Now, if you will have the great goodness to open that door very

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: quietly, we will soon make him cut a much more respectable

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: figure."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Well, I don't know why not," said the inspector. "He doesn't

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: look a credit to the Bow Street cells, does he?" He slipped his

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: key into the lock, and we all very quietly entered the cell. The

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: sleeper half turned, and then settled down once more into a deep

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: slumber. Holmes stooped to the water-jug, moistened his sponge,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: and then rubbed it twice vigorously across and down the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: prisoner's face.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Let me introduce you," he shouted, "to Mr. Neville St. Clair, of

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: Lee, in the county of Kent."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: Never in my life have I seen such a sight. The man's face peeled

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: off under the sponge like the bark from a tree. Gone was the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: coarse brown tint! Gone, too, was the horrid scar which had

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: seamed it across, and the twisted lip which had given the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: repulsive sneer to the face! A twitch brought away the tangled

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: red hair, and there, sitting up in his bed, was a pale,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: sad-faced, refined-looking man, black-haired and smooth-skinned,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: rubbing his eyes and staring about him with sleepy bewilderment.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: Then suddenly realising the exposure, he broke into a scream and

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: threw himself down with his face to the pillow.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Great heavens!" cried the inspector, "it is, indeed, the missing

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: man. I know him from the photograph."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: The prisoner turned with the reckless air of a man who abandons

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: himself to his destiny. "Be it so," said he. "And pray what am I

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: charged with?"

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "With making away with Mr. Neville St.-- Oh, come, you can't be

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: charged with that unless they make a case of attempted suicide of

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: it," said the inspector with a grin. "Well, I have been

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: twenty-seven years in the force, but this really takes the cake."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "If I am Mr. Neville St. Clair, then it is obvious that no crime

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: has been committed, and that, therefore, I am illegally

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: detained."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "No crime, but a very great error has been committed," said

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: Holmes. "You would have done better to have trusted your wife."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "It was not the wife; it was the children," groaned the prisoner.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "God help me, I would not have them ashamed of their father. My

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: God! What an exposure! What can I do?"

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: Sherlock Holmes sat down beside him on the couch and patted him

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: kindly on the shoulder.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "If you leave it to a court of law to clear the matter up," said

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: he, "of course you can hardly avoid publicity. On the other hand,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: if you convince the police authorities that there is no possible

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: case against you, I do not know that there is any reason that the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: details should find their way into the papers. Inspector

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: Bradstreet would, I am sure, make notes upon anything which you

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: might tell us and submit it to the proper authorities. The case

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: would then never go into court at all."

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "God bless you!" cried the prisoner passionately. "I would have

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: endured imprisonment, ay, even execution, rather than have left

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: my miserable secret as a family blot to my children.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "You are the first who have ever heard my story. My father was a

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: schoolmaster in Chesterfield, where I received an excellent

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: education. I travelled in my youth, took to the stage, and

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: finally became a reporter on an evening paper in London. One day

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: my editor wished to have a series of articles upon begging in the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: metropolis, and I volunteered to supply them. There was the point

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: from which all my adventures started. It was only by trying

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: begging as an amateur that I could get the facts upon which to

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: base my articles. When an actor I had, of course, learned all the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: secrets of making up, and had been famous in the green-room for

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: my skill. I took advantage now of my attainments. I painted my

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: face, and to make myself as pitiable as possible I made a good

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: scar and fixed one side of my lip in a twist by the aid of a

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: small slip of flesh-coloured plaster. Then with a red head of

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: hair, and an appropriate dress, I took my station in the business

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: part of the city, ostensibly as a match-seller but really as a

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: beggar. For seven hours I plied my trade, and when I returned

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: home in the evening I found to my surprise that I had received no

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: less than 26s. 4d.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "I wrote my articles and thought little more of the matter until,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: some time later, I backed a bill for a friend and had a writ

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: served upon me for 25 pounds. I was at my wit's end where to get

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: the money, but a sudden idea came to me. I begged a fortnight's

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: grace from the creditor, asked for a holiday from my employers,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: and spent the time in begging in the City under my disguise. In

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: ten days I had the money and had paid the debt.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Well, you can imagine how hard it was to settle down to arduous

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: work at 2 pounds a week when I knew that I could earn as much in

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: a day by smearing my face with a little paint, laying my cap on

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: the ground, and sitting still. It was a long fight between my

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: pride and the money, but the dollars won at last, and I threw up

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: reporting and sat day after day in the corner which I had first

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: chosen, inspiring pity by my ghastly face and filling my pockets

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: with coppers. Only one man knew my secret. He was the keeper of a

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: low den in which I used to lodge in Swandam Lane, where I could

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: every morning emerge as a squalid beggar and in the evenings

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: transform myself into a well-dressed man about town. This fellow,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: a Lascar, was well paid by me for his rooms, so that I knew that

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: my secret was safe in his possession.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Well, very soon I found that I was saving considerable sums of

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: money. I do not mean that any beggar in the streets of London

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: could earn 700 pounds a year--which is less than my average

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: takings--but I had exceptional advantages in my power of making

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: up, and also in a facility of repartee, which improved by

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: practice and made me quite a recognised character in the City.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: All day a stream of pennies, varied by silver, poured in upon me,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: and it was a very bad day in which I failed to take 2 pounds.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "As I grew richer I grew more ambitious, took a house in the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: country, and eventually married, without anyone having a

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: suspicion as to my real occupation. My dear wife knew that I had

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: business in the City. She little knew what.

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: NA

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: "Last Monday I had finished for the day and was dressing in my

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: room above the opium den when I looked out of my window and saw,

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: to my horror and astonishment, that my wife was standing in the

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: street, with her eyes fixed full upon me. I gave a cry of

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: surprise, threw up my arms to cover my face, and, rushing to my

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: confidant, the Lascar, entreated him to prevent anyone from

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: coming up to me. I heard her voice downstairs, but I knew that

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: she could not ascend. Swiftly I threw off my clothes, pulled on

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: those of a beggar, and put on my pigments and wig. Even a wife's

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: eyes could not pierce so complete a disguise. But then it

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: occurred to me that there might be a search in the room, and that

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: the clothes might betray me. I threw open the window, reopening

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: by my violence a small cut which I had inflicted upon myself in

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: the bedroom that morning. Then I seized my coat, which was

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP
text: weighted by the coppers which I had just transferred to it from

story: ADVENTURE VI. THE MAN WITH THE TWISTED LIP

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: I had called upon my friend Sherlock Holmes upon the second

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: morning after Christmas, with the intention of wishing him the

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: compliments of the season. He was lounging upon the sofa in a

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: purple dressing-gown, a pipe-rack within his reach upon the

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: right, and a pile of crumpled morning papers, evidently newly

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: studied, near at hand. Beside the couch was a wooden chair, and

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: on the angle of the back hung a very seedy and disreputable

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: hard-felt hat, much the worse for wear, and cracked in several

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: places. A lens and a forceps lying upon the seat of the chair

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: suggested that the hat had been suspended in this manner for the

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: purpose of examination.

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: "You are engaged," said I; "perhaps I interrupt you."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: "Not at all. I am glad to have a friend with whom I can discuss

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: my results. The matter is a perfectly trivial one"--he jerked his

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: thumb in the direction of the old hat--"but there are points in

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: connection with it which are not entirely devoid of interest and

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: even of instruction."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: I seated myself in his armchair and warmed my hands before his

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: crackling fire, for a sharp frost had set in, and the windows

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: were thick with the ice crystals. "I suppose," I remarked, "that,

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: homely as it looks, this thing has some deadly story linked on to

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: it--that it is the clue which will guide you in the solution of

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: some mystery and the punishment of some crime."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: "No, no. No crime," said Sherlock Holmes, laughing. "Only one of

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: those whimsical little incidents which will happen when you have

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: four million human beings all jostling each other within the

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: space of a few square miles. Amid the action and reaction of so

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: dense a swarm of humanity, every possible combination of events

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: may be expected to take place, and many a little problem will be

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: presented which may be striking and bizarre without being

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: criminal. We have already had experience of such."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: "So much so," I remarked, "that of the last six cases which I

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: have added to my notes, three have been entirely free of any

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: legal crime."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: "Precisely. You allude to my attempt to recover the Irene Adler

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: papers, to the singular case of Miss Mary Sutherland, and to the

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: adventure of the man with the twisted lip. Well, I have no doubt

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: that this small matter will fall into the same innocent category.

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: You know Peterson, the commissionaire?"

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: "Yes."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: "It is to him that this trophy belongs."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: "It is his hat."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: "No, no, he found it. Its owner is unknown. I beg that you will

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: look upon it not as a battered billycock but as an intellectual

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: problem. And, first, as to how it came here. It arrived upon

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: Christmas morning, in company with a good fat goose, which is, I

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: have no doubt, roasting at this moment in front of Peterson's

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: fire. The facts are these: about four o'clock on Christmas

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: morning, Peterson, who, as you know, is a very honest fellow, was

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: returning from some small jollification and was making his way

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: homeward down Tottenham Court Road. In front of him he saw, in

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: the gaslight, a tallish man, walking with a slight stagger, and

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: carrying a white goose slung over his shoulder. As he reached the

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: corner of Goodge Street, a row broke out between this stranger

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: and a little knot of roughs. One of the latter knocked off the

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: man's hat, on which he raised his stick to defend himself and,

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: swinging it over his head, smashed the shop window behind him.

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: Peterson had rushed forward to protect the stranger from his

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: assailants; but the man, shocked at having broken the window, and

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: seeing an official-looking person in uniform rushing towards him,

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: dropped his goose, took to his heels, and vanished amid the

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: labyrinth of small streets which lie at the back of Tottenham

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: Court Road. The roughs had also fled at the appearance of

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: Peterson, so that he was left in possession of the field of

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: battle, and also of the spoils of victory in the shape of this

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: battered hat and a most unimpeachable Christmas goose."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: this city of ours, it is not easy to restore lost property to any

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: one of them."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: knowing that even the smallest problems are of interest to me.

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: should be eaten without unnecessary delay. Its finder has carried

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: it off, therefore, to fulfil the ultimate destiny of a goose,

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: while I continue to retain the hat of the unknown gentleman who

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: lost his Christmas dinner."

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: It was a bitter night, so we drew on our ulsters and wrapped

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: cravats about our throats. Outside, the stars were shining coldly

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: in a cloudless sky, and the breath of the passers-by blew out

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: into smoke like so many pistol shots. Our footfalls rang out

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: crisply and loudly as we swung through the doctors' quarter,

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: Wimpole Street, Harley Street, and so through Wigmore Street into

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: Oxford Street. In a quarter of an hour we were in Bloomsbury at

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: the Alpha Inn, which is a small public-house at the corner of one

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: of the streets which runs down into Holborn. Holmes pushed open

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: the door of the private bar and ordered two glasses of beer from

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: the ruddy-faced, white-aproned landlord.

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

text: NA

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

text: "Now for Mr. Breckinridge," he continued, buttoning up his coat

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: as we came out into the frosty air. "Remember, Watson that though

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: have at the other a man who will certainly get seven years' penal

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: have a line of investigation which has been missed by the police,

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: and which a singular chance has placed in our hands. Let us

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: follow it out to the bitter end. Faces to the south, then, and

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: quick march!"

text: And no more words were needed. There was a rush, a clatter upon

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: the stairs, the bang of a door, and the crisp rattle of running

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: "After all, Watson," said Holmes, reaching up his hand for his

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: clay pipe, "I am not retained by the police to supply their

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: deficiencies. If Horner were in danger it would be another thing;

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: but this fellow will not appear against him, and the case must

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: collapse. I suppose that I am commuting a felony, but it is just

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: you make him a gaol-bird for life. Besides, it is the season of

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: forgiveness. Chance has put in our way a most singular and

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: whimsical problem, and its solution is its own reward. If you

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE
text: will have the goodness to touch the bell, Doctor, we will begin

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BLUE CARBUNCLE

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: On glancing over my notes of the seventy odd cases in which I

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: have during the last eight years studied the methods of my friend

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Sherlock Holmes, I find many tragic, some comic, a large number

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: merely strange, but none commonplace; for, working as he did

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: rather for the love of his art than for the acquirement of

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: wealth, he refused to associate himself with any investigation

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: which did not tend towards the unusual, and even the fantastic.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Of all these varied cases, however, I cannot recall any which

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: presented more singular features than that which was associated

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: with the well-known Surrey family of the Roylotts of Stoke Moran.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: The events in question occurred in the early days of my

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: association with Holmes, when we were sharing rooms as bachelors

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: in Baker Street. It is possible that I might have placed them

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: upon record before, but a promise of secrecy was made at the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: time, from which I have only been freed during the last month by

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: the untimely death of the lady to whom the pledge was given. It

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: is perhaps as well that the facts should now come to light, for I

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: have reasons to know that there are widespread rumours as to the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: death of Dr. Grimesby Roylott which tend to make the matter even

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: more terrible than the truth.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: It was early in April in the year '83 that I woke one morning to

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: find Sherlock Holmes standing, fully dressed, by the side of my

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: bed. He was a late riser, as a rule, and as the clock on the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: mantelpiece showed me that it was only a quarter-past seven, I

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: blinked up at him in some surprise, and perhaps just a little

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: resentment, for I was myself regular in my habits.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Very sorry to knock you up, Watson," said he, "but it's the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: common lot this morning. Mrs. Hudson has been knocked up, she

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: retorted upon me, and I on you."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "What is it, then--a fire?"

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "No; a client. It seems that a young lady has arrived in a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: considerable state of excitement, who insists upon seeing me. She

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: is waiting now in the sitting-room. Now, when young ladies wander

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: about the metropolis at this hour of the morning, and knock

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: sleepy people up out of their beds, I presume that it is

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: something very pressing which they have to communicate. Should it

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: prove to be an interesting case, you would, I am sure, wish to

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: follow it from the outset. I thought, at any rate, that I should

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: call you and give you the chance."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "My dear fellow, I would not miss it for anything."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: I had no keener pleasure than in following Holmes in his

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: professional investigations, and in admiring the rapid

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: deductions, as swift as intuitions, and yet always founded on a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: logical basis with which he unravelled the problems which were

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: submitted to him. I rapidly threw on my clothes and was ready in

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: a few minutes to accompany my friend down to the sitting-room. A

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: lady dressed in black and heavily veiled, who had been sitting in

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: the window, rose as we entered.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Good-morning, madam," said Holmes cheerily. "My name is Sherlock

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Holmes. This is my intimate friend and associate, Dr. Watson,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: before whom you can speak as freely as before myself. Ha! I am

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: glad to see that Mrs. Hudson has had the good sense to light the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: fire. Pray draw up to it, and I shall order you a cup of hot

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: coffee, for I observe that you are shivering."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: voice, changing her seat as requested.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: she spoke, and we could see that she was indeed in a pitiable

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: state of agitation, her face all drawn and grey, with restless

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: and figure were those of a woman of thirty, but her hair was shot

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: with premature grey, and her expression was weary and haggard.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Sherlock Holmes ran her over with one of his quick,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: patting her forearm. "We shall soon set matters right, I have no

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: doubt. You have come in by train this morning, I see."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: a good drive in a dog-cart, along heavy roads, before you reached

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "There is no mystery, my dear madam," said he, smiling. "The left

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: arm of your jacket is spattered with mud in no less than seven

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Whatever your reasons may be, you are perfectly correct," said

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: she. "I started from home before six, reached Leatherhead at

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: twenty past, and came in by the first train to Waterloo. Sir, I

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: can stand this strain no longer; I shall go mad if it continues.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: I have no one to turn to--none, save only one, who cares for me,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: and he, poor fellow, can be of little aid. I have heard of you,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: helped in the hour of her sore need. It was from her that I had

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: your address. Oh, sir, do you not think that you could help me,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: too, and at least throw a little light through the dense darkness

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: which surrounds me? At present it is out of my power to reward

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: you for your services, but in a month or six weeks I shall be

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: married, with the control of my own income, and then at least you

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: shall not find me ungrateful."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: the same care to your case as I did to that of your friend. As to

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: everything that may help us in forming an opinion upon the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

text: "Alas!" replied our visitor, "the very horror of my situation

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: lies in the fact that my fears are so vague, and my suspicions

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: depend so entirely upon small points, which might seem trivial to

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: another, that even he to whom of all others I have a right to

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: look for help and advice looks upon all that I tell him about it

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: as the fancies of a nervous woman. He does not say so, but I can

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: read it from his soothing answers and averted eyes. But I have

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: heard, Mr. Holmes, that you can see deeply into the manifold

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: wickedness of the human heart. You may advise me how to walk amid

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: the dangers which encompass me."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "I am all attention, madam."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "My name is Helen Stoner, and I am living with my stepfather, who

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: is the last survivor of one of the oldest Saxon families in

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: England, the Roylotts of Stoke Moran, on the western border of

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Surrey."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Holmes nodded his head. "The name is familiar to me," said he.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "The family was at one time among the richest in England, and the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: estates extended over the borders into Berkshire in the north,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: and Hampshire in the west. In the last century, however, four

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: successive heirs were of a dissolute and wasteful disposition,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: and the family ruin was eventually completed by a gambler in the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: days of the Regency. Nothing was left save a few acres of ground,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: and the two-hundred-year-old house, which is itself crushed under

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: a heavy mortgage. The last squire dragged out his existence

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: there, living the horrible life of an aristocratic pauper; but

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: his only son, my stepfather, seeing that he must adapt himself to

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: the new conditions, obtained an advance from a relative, which

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: enabled him to take a medical degree and went out to Calcutta,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: where, by his professional skill and his force of character, he

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: established a large practice. In a fit of anger, however, caused

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: by some robberies which had been perpetrated in the house, he

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: beat his native butler to death and narrowly escaped a capital

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: sentence. As it was, he suffered a long term of imprisonment and

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: afterwards returned to England a morose and disappointed man.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "When Dr. Roylott was in India he married my mother, Mrs. Stoner,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: the young widow of Major-General Stoner, of the Bengal Artillery.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: My sister Julia and I were twins, and we were only two years old

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: at the time of my mother's re-marriage. She had a considerable

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: sum of money--not less than 1000 pounds a year--and this she

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: bequeathed to Dr. Roylott entirely while we resided with him,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: with a provision that a certain annual sum should be allowed to

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: each of us in the event of our marriage. Shortly after our return

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: to England my mother died--she was killed eight years ago in a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: railway accident near Crewe. Dr. Roylott then abandoned his

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: attempts to establish himself in practice in London and took us

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: to live with him in the old ancestral house at Stoke Moran. The

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: money which my mother had left was enough for all our wants, and

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: there seemed to be no obstacle to our happiness.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "But a terrible change came over our stepfather about this time.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Instead of making friends and exchanging visits with our

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: neighbours, who had at first been overjoyed to see a Roylott of

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Stoke Moran back in the old family seat, he shut himself up in

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: his house and seldom came out save to indulge in ferocious

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: quarrels with whoever might cross his path. Violence of temper

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: approaching to mania has been hereditary in the men of the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: family, and in my stepfather's case it had, I believe, been

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: intensified by his long residence in the tropics. A series of

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: disgraceful brawls took place, two of which ended in the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: police-court, until at last he became the terror of the village,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: and the folks would fly at his approach, for he is a man of

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: immense strength, and absolutely uncontrollable in his anger.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Last week he hurled the local blacksmith over a parapet into a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: stream, and it was only by paying over all the money which I

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: could gather together that I was able to avert another public

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: exposure. He had no friends at all save the wandering gipsies,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: and he would give these vagabonds leave to encamp upon the few

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: acres of bramble-covered land which represent the family estate,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: and would accept in return the hospitality of their tents,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: wandering away with them sometimes for weeks on end. He has a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: passion also for Indian animals, which are sent over to him by a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: correspondent, and he has at this moment a cheetah and a baboon,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: which wander freely over his grounds and are feared by the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: villagers almost as much as their master.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "You can imagine from what I say that my poor sister Julia and I

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: had no great pleasure in our lives. No servant would stay with

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: us, and for a long time we did all the work of the house. She was

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: but thirty at the time of her death, and yet her hair had already

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: begun to whiten, even as mine has."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Your sister is dead, then?"

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "She died just two years ago, and it is of her death that I wish

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: to speak to you. You can understand that, living the life which I

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: have described, we were little likely to see anyone of our own

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: age and position. We had, however, an aunt, my mother's maiden

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: sister, Miss Honoria Westphail, who lives near Harrow, and we

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: were occasionally allowed to pay short visits at this lady's

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: house. Julia went there at Christmas two years ago, and met there

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: a half-pay major of marines, to whom she became engaged. My

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: stepfather learned of the engagement when my sister returned and

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "I could not sleep that night. A vague feeling of impending

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: misfortune impressed me. My sister and I, you will recollect,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: were twins, and you know how subtle are the links which bind two

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: souls which are so closely allied. It was a wild night. The wind

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: was howling outside, and the rain was beating and splashing

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: against the windows. Suddenly, amid all the hubbub of the gale,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: fallen. As I ran down the passage, my sister's door was unlocked,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: and revolved slowly upon its hinges. I stared at it

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: horror-stricken, not knowing what was about to issue from it. By

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: the light of the corridor-lamp I saw my sister appear at the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: opening, her face blanched with terror, her hands groping for

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: help, her whole figure swaying to and fro like that of a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: drunkard. I ran to her and threw my arms round her, but at that

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: moment her knees seemed to give way and she fell to the ground.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: in a voice which I shall never forget, 'Oh, my God! Helen! It was

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: would fain have said, and she stabbed with her finger into the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: air in the direction of the doctor's room, but a fresh convulsion

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: seized her and choked her words. I rushed out, calling loudly for

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: dressing-gown. When he reached my sister's side she was

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: unconscious, and though he poured brandy down her throat and sent

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: for medical aid from the village, all efforts were in vain, for

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: she slowly sank and died without having recovered her

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: consciousness. Such was the dreadful end of my beloved sister."

text: "And so do I. It is precisely for that reason that we are going

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: The ejaculation had been drawn from my companion by the fact that

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: our door had been suddenly dashed open, and that a huge man had

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: framed himself in the aperture. His costume was a peculiar

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: mixture of the professional and of the agricultural, having a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: black top-hat, a long frock-coat, and a pair of high gaiters,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: with a hunting-crop swinging in his hand. So tall was he that his

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: hat actually brushed the cross bar of the doorway, and his

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: breadth seemed to span it across from side to side. A large face,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: seared with a thousand wrinkles, burned yellow with the sun, and

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: marked with every evil passion, was turned from one to the other

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: of us, while his deep-set, bile-shot eyes, and his high, thin,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: fleshless nose, gave him somewhat the resemblance to a fierce old

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: bird of prey.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Which of you is Holmes?" asked this apparition.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "My name, sir; but you have the advantage of me," said my

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: companion quietly.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "I am Dr. Grimesby Roylott, of Stoke Moran."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Indeed, Doctor," said Holmes blandly. "Pray take a seat."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "I will do nothing of the kind. My stepdaughter has been here. I

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: have traced her. What has she been saying to you?"

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "It is a little cold for the time of the year," said Holmes.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "What has she been saying to you?" screamed the old man

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: furiously.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "But I have heard that the crocuses promise well," continued my

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: companion imperturbably.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Ha! You put me off, do you?" said our new visitor, taking a step

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: forward and shaking his hunting-crop. "I know you, you scoundrel!

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: I have heard of you before. You are Holmes, the meddler."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: My friend smiled.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Holmes, the busybody!"

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: His smile broadened.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Holmes, the Scotland Yard Jack-in-office!"

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Holmes chuckled heartily. "Your conversation is most

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: entertaining," said he. "When you go out close the door, for

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: there is a decided draught."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "I will go when I have said my say. Don't you dare to meddle with

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: my affairs. I know that Miss Stoner has been here. I traced her!

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: I am a dangerous man to fall foul of! See here." He stepped

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: swiftly forward, seized the poker, and bent it into a curve with

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: his huge brown hands.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "See that you keep yourself out of my grip," he snarled, and

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: hurling the twisted poker into the fireplace he strode out of the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: room.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "He seems a very amiable person," said Holmes, laughing. "I am

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: not quite so bulky, but if he had remained I might have shown him

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: that my grip was not much more feeble than his own." As he spoke

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: he picked up the steel poker and, with a sudden effort,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: straightened it out again.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Fancy his having the insolence to confound me with the official

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: detective force! This incident gives zest to our investigation,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: however, and I only trust that our little friend will not suffer

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: from her imprudence in allowing this brute to trace her. And now,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Watson, we shall order breakfast, and afterwards I shall walk

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: down to Doctors' Commons, where I hope to get some data which may

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: help us in this matter."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: It was nearly one o'clock when Sherlock Holmes returned from his

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: excursion. He held in his hand a sheet of blue paper, scrawled

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: over with notes and figures.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "I have seen the will of the deceased wife," said he. "To

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: determine its exact meaning I have been obliged to work out the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: present prices of the investments with which it is concerned. The

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: total income, which at the time of the wife's death was little

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: short of 1100 pounds, is now, through the fall in agricultural

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: prices, not more than 750 pounds. Each daughter can claim an

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: income of 250 pounds, in case of marriage. It is evident,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: therefore, that if both girls had married, this beauty would have

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: had a mere pittance, while even one of them would cripple him to

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: a very serious extent. My morning's work has not been wasted,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: since it has proved that he has the very strongest motives for

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: standing in the way of anything of the sort. And now, Watson,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: this is too serious for dawdling, especially as the old man is

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: aware that we are interesting ourselves in his affairs; so if you

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: are ready, we shall call a cab and drive to Waterloo. I should be

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: very much obliged if you would slip your revolver into your

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: pocket. An Eley's No. 2 is an excellent argument with gentlemen

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: who can twist steel pokers into knots. That and a tooth-brush

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: are, I think, all that we need."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: At Waterloo we were fortunate in catching a train for

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Leatherhead, where we hired a trap at the station inn and drove

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: for four or five miles through the lovely Surrey lanes. It was a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: perfect day, with a bright sun and a few fleecy clouds in the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: heavens. The trees and wayside hedges were just throwing out

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: their first green shoots, and the air was full of the pleasant

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: smell of the moist earth. To me at least there was a strange

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: contrast between the sweet promise of the spring and this

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: sinister quest upon which we were engaged. My companion sat in

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: the front of the trap, his arms folded, his hat pulled down over

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: his eyes, and his chin sunk upon his breast, buried in the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: deepest thought. Suddenly, however, he started, tapped me on the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: shoulder, and pointed over the meadows.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Look there!" said he.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: A heavily timbered park stretched up in a gentle slope,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: thickening into a grove at the highest point. From amid the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: branches there jutted out the grey gables and high roof-tree of a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: very old mansion.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Stoke Moran?" said he.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Yes, sir, that be the house of Dr. Grimesby Roylott," remarked

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: the driver.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "There is some building going on there," said Holmes; "that is

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: where we are going."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "There's the village," said the driver, pointing to a cluster of

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: roofs some distance to the left; "but if you want to get to the

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: house, you'll find it shorter to get over this stile, and so by

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: the foot-path over the fields. There it is, where the lady is

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: walking."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "And the lady, I fancy, is Miss Stoner," observed Holmes, shading

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: his eyes. "Yes, I think we had better do as you suggest."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: We got off, paid our fare, and the trap rattled back on its way

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: to Leatherhead.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "I thought it as well," said Holmes as we climbed the stile,

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "that this fellow should think we had come here as architects, or

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: on some definite business. It may stop his gossip.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Good-afternoon, Miss Stoner. You see that we have been as good as

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: our word."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: Our client of the morning had hurried forward to meet us with a

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: face which spoke her joy. "I have been waiting so eagerly for

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: you," she cried, shaking hands with us warmly. "All has turned

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: out splendidly. Dr. Roylott has gone to town, and it is unlikely

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: that he will be back before evening."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "We have had the pleasure of making the doctor's acquaintance,"

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: said Holmes, and in a few words he sketched out what had

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: occurred. Miss Stoner turned white to the lips as she listened.

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "Good heavens!" she cried, "he has followed me, then."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "So it appears."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "He is so cunning that I never know when I am safe from him. What

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: will he say when he returns?"

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: NA

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: "He must guard himself, for he may find that there is someone

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: more cunning than himself upon his track. You must lock yourself

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: up from him to-night. If he is violent, we shall take you away to

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: your aunt's at Harrow. Now, we must make the best use of our

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: time, so kindly take us at once to the rooms which we are to

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
text: examine."

story: VIII. THE ADVENTURE OF THE SPECKLED BAND
