story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Perhaps we may make them less so."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Such as they are, they are set forth in a single article of a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: morning paper of yesterday, which I will read to you. It is

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: headed, 'Singular Occurrence at a Fashionable Wedding':

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "'The family of Lord Robert St. Simon has been thrown into the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: greatest consternation by the strange and painful episodes which

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: have taken place in connection with his wedding. The ceremony, as

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: shortly announced in the papers of yesterday, occurred on the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: previous morning; but it is only now that it has been possible to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: confirm the strange rumours which have been so persistently

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: floating about. In spite of the attempts of the friends to hush

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the matter up, so much public attention has now been drawn to it

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: that no good purpose can be served by affecting to disregard what

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: is a common subject for conversation.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "'The ceremony, which was performed at St. George's, Hanover

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Square, was a very quiet one, no one being present save the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: father of the bride, Mr. Aloysius Doran, the Duchess of Balmoral,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Lord Backwater, Lord Eustace and Lady Clara St. Simon (the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: younger brother and sister of the bridegroom), and Lady Alicia

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Whittington. The whole party proceeded afterwards to the house of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Mr. Aloysius Doran, at Lancaster Gate, where breakfast had been

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: prepared. It appears that some little trouble was caused by a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: woman, whose name has not been ascertained, who endeavoured to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: force her way into the house after the bridal party, alleging

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: that she had some claim upon Lord St. Simon. It was only after a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: painful and prolonged scene that she was ejected by the butler

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: and the footman. The bride, who had fortunately entered the house

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: before this unpleasant interruption, had sat down to breakfast

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: with the rest, when she complained of a sudden indisposition and

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: retired to her room. Her prolonged absence having caused some

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: comment, her father followed her, but learned from her maid that

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: she had only come up to her chamber for an instant, caught up an

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: ulster and bonnet, and hurried down to the passage. One of the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: footmen declared that he had seen a lady leave the house thus

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: apparelled, but had refused to credit that it was his mistress,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: believing her to be with the company. On ascertaining that his

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: daughter had disappeared, Mr. Aloysius Doran, in conjunction with

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the bridegroom, instantly put themselves in communication with

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the police, and very energetic inquiries are being made, which

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: will probably result in a speedy clearing up of this very

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: singular business. Up to a late hour last night, however, nothing

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: had transpired as to the whereabouts of the missing lady. There

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: are rumours of foul play in the matter, and it is said that the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: police have caused the arrest of the woman who had caused the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: original disturbance, in the belief that, from jealousy or some

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: other motive, she may have been concerned in the strange

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: disappearance of the bride.'"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "And is that all?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Only one little item in another of the morning papers, but it is

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: a suggestive one."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "And it is--"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "That Miss Flora Millar, the lady who had caused the disturbance,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: has actually been arrested. It appears that she was formerly a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: danseuse at the Allegro, and that she has known the bridegroom

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: for some years. There are no further particulars, and the whole

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: case is in your hands now--so far as it has been set forth in the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "And an exceedingly interesting case it appears to be. I would

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: not have missed it for worlds. But there is a ring at the bell,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Watson, and as the clock makes it a few minutes after four, I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: have no doubt that this will prove to be our noble client. Do not

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: dream of going, Watson, for I very much prefer having a witness,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: if only as a check to my own memory."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Lord Robert St. Simon," announced our page-boy, throwing open

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the door. A gentleman entered, with a pleasant, cultured face,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: high-nosed and pale, with something perhaps of petulance about

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the mouth, and with the steady, well-opened eye of a man whose

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: pleasant lot it had ever been to command and to be obeyed. His

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: manner was brisk, and yet his general appearance gave an undue

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: impression of age, for he had a slight forward stoop and a little

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: bend of the knees as he walked. His hair, too, as he swept off

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: his very curly-brimmed hat, was grizzled round the edges and thin

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: upon the top. As to his dress, it was careful to the verge of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: foppishness, with high collar, black frock-coat, white waistcoat,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: yellow gloves, patent-leather shoes, and light-coloured gaiters.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: He advanced slowly into the room, turning his head from left to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: right, and swinging in his right hand the cord which held his

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: golden eyeglasses.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Good-day, Lord St. Simon," said Holmes, rising and bowing. "Pray

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: take the basket-chair. This is my friend and colleague, Dr.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Watson. Draw up a little to the fire, and we will talk this

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: matter over."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "A most painful matter to me, as you can most readily imagine,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Mr. Holmes. I have been cut to the quick. I understand that you

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: have already managed several delicate cases of this sort, sir,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: though I presume that they were hardly from the same class of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: society."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "No, I am descending."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "I beg pardon."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "My last client of the sort was a king."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Oh, really! I had no idea. And which king?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "The King of Scandinavia."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "What! Had he lost his wife?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "You can understand," said Holmes suavely, "that I extend to the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: affairs of my other clients the same secrecy which I promise to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: you in yours."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Of course! Very right! very right! I'm sure I beg pardon. As to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: my own case, I am ready to give you any information which may

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: assist you in forming an opinion."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Thank you. I have already learned all that is in the public

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: prints, nothing more. I presume that I may take it as correct--this

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: article, for example, as to the disappearance of the bride."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Lord St. Simon glanced over it. "Yes, it is correct, as far as it

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: goes."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "But it needs a great deal of supplementing before anyone could

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: offer an opinion. I think that I may arrive at my facts most

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: directly by questioning you."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Pray do so."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "When did you first meet Miss Hatty Doran?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "In San Francisco, a year ago."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "You were travelling in the States?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Yes."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Did you become engaged then?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "No."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "But you were on a friendly footing?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "I was amused by her society, and she could see that I was

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: amused."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Her father is very rich?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "He is said to be the richest man on the Pacific slope."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "And how did he make his money?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "In mining. He had nothing a few years ago. Then he struck gold,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: invested it, and came up by leaps and bounds."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Now, what is your own impression as to the young lady's--your

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: wife's character?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: The nobleman swung his glasses a little faster and stared down

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: into the fire. "You see, Mr. Holmes," said he, "my wife was

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: twenty before her father became a rich man. During that time she

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: ran free in a mining camp and wandered through woods or

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: mountains, so that her education has come from Nature rather than

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: from the schoolmaster. She is what we call in England a tomboy,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: with a strong nature, wild and free, unfettered by any sort of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: traditions. She is impetuous--volcanic, I was about to say. She

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: is swift in making up her mind and fearless in carrying out her

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: resolutions. On the other hand, I would not have given her the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: name which I have the honour to bear"--he gave a little stately

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: cough--"had not I thought her to be at bottom a noble woman. I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: believe that she is capable of heroic self-sacrifice and that

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: anything dishonourable would be repugnant to her."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Have you her photograph?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "I brought this with me." He opened a locket and showed us the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: full face of a very lovely woman. It was not a photograph but an

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: ivory miniature, and the artist had brought out the full effect

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: of the lustrous black hair, the large dark eyes, and the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: exquisite mouth. Holmes gazed long and earnestly at it. Then he

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: closed the locket and handed it back to Lord St. Simon.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "The young lady came to London, then, and you renewed your

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: acquaintance?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Yes, her father brought her over for this last London season. I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: met her several times, became engaged to her, and have now

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: married her."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "She brought, I understand, a considerable dowry?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "A fair dowry. Not more than is usual in my family."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "And this, of course, remains to you, since the marriage is a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: fait accompli?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "I really have made no inquiries on the subject."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Very naturally not. Did you see Miss Doran on the day before the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: wedding?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Yes."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Was she in good spirits?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Never better. She kept talking of what we should do in our

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: future lives."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Indeed! That is very interesting. And on the morning of the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: wedding?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "She was as bright as possible--at least until after the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: ceremony."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "And did you observe any change in her then?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Well, to tell the truth, I saw then the first signs that I had

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: ever seen that her temper was just a little sharp. The incident

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: however, was too trivial to relate and can have no possible

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: bearing upon the case."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Pray let us have it, for all that."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Oh, it is childish. She dropped her bouquet as we went towards

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the vestry. She was passing the front pew at the time, and it

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: fell over into the pew. There was a moment's delay, but the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: gentleman in the pew handed it up to her again, and it did not

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: appear to be the worse for the fall. Yet when I spoke to her of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the matter, she answered me abruptly; and in the carriage, on our

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: way home, she seemed absurdly agitated over this trifling cause."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Indeed! You say that there was a gentleman in the pew. Some of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the general public were present, then?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Oh, yes. It is impossible to exclude them when the church is

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: open."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "This gentleman was not one of your wife's friends?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "No, no; I call him a gentleman by courtesy, but he was quite a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: common-looking person. I hardly noticed his appearance. But

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: really I think that we are wandering rather far from the point."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Lady St. Simon, then, returned from the wedding in a less

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: cheerful frame of mind than she had gone to it. What did she do

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: on re-entering her father's house?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "I saw her in conversation with her maid."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "And who is her maid?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Alice is her name. She is an American and came from California

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: with her."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "A confidential servant?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "A little too much so. It seemed to me that her mistress allowed

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: her to take great liberties. Still, of course, in America they

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: look upon these things in a different way."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "How long did she speak to this Alice?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Oh, a few minutes. I had something else to think of."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "You did not overhear what they said?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Lady St. Simon said something about 'jumping a claim.' She was

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: accustomed to use slang of the kind. I have no idea what she

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: meant."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "American slang is very expressive sometimes. And what did your

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: wife do when she finished speaking to her maid?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "She walked into the breakfast-room."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "On your arm?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "No, alone. She was very independent in little matters like that.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Then, after we had sat down for ten minutes or so, she rose

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: hurriedly, muttered some words of apology, and left the room. She

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: never came back."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "But this maid, Alice, as I understand, deposes that she went to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: her room, covered her bride's dress with a long ulster, put on a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: bonnet, and went out."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Quite so. And she was afterwards seen walking into Hyde Park in

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: company with Flora Millar, a woman who is now in custody, and who

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: had already made a disturbance at Mr. Doran's house that

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: morning."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Ah, yes. I should like a few particulars as to this young lady,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: and your relations to her."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Lord St. Simon shrugged his shoulders and raised his eyebrows.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "We have been on a friendly footing for some years--I may say on

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: a very friendly footing. She used to be at the Allegro. I have

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: not treated her ungenerously, and she had no just cause of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: complaint against me, but you know what women are, Mr. Holmes.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Flora was a dear little thing, but exceedingly hot-headed and

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: devotedly attached to me. She wrote me dreadful letters when she

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: heard that I was about to be married, and, to tell the truth, the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: reason why I had the marriage celebrated so quietly was that I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: feared lest there might be a scandal in the church. She came to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Mr. Doran's door just after we returned, and she endeavoured to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: push her way in, uttering very abusive expressions towards my

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: wife, and even threatening her, but I had foreseen the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: possibility of something of the sort, and I had two police

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: fellows there in private clothes, who soon pushed her out again.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: She was quiet when she saw that there was no good in making a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: row."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Did your wife hear all this?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "No, thank goodness, she did not."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "And she was seen walking with this very woman afterwards?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Yes. That is what Mr. Lestrade, of Scotland Yard, looks upon as

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: so serious. It is thought that Flora decoyed my wife out and laid

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: some terrible trap for her."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Well, it is a possible supposition."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "You think so, too?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "I did not say a probable one. But you do not yourself look upon

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: this as likely?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "I do not think Flora would hurt a fly."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Still, jealousy is a strange transformer of characters. Pray

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: what is your own theory as to what took place?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Well, really, I came to seek a theory, not to propound one. I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: have given you all the facts. Since you ask me, however, I may

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: say that it has occurred to me as possible that the excitement of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: this affair, the consciousness that she had made so immense a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: social stride, had the effect of causing some little nervous

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: disturbance in my wife."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "In short, that she had become suddenly deranged?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Well, really, when I consider that she has turned her back--I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: will not say upon me, but upon so much that many have aspired to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: without success--I can hardly explain it in any other fashion."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Well, certainly that is also a conceivable hypothesis," said

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Holmes, smiling. "And now, Lord St. Simon, I think that I have

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: nearly all my data. May I ask whether you were seated at the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: breakfast-table so that you could see out of the window?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "We could see the other side of the road and the Park."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Quite so. Then I do not think that I need to detain you longer.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: I shall communicate with you."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Should you be fortunate enough to solve this problem," said our

text: "Oh, yes, I know that I have treated you real bad and that I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: should have spoken to you before I went; but I was kind of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: rattled, and from the time when I saw Frank here again I just

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: didn't know what I was doing or saying. I only wonder I didn't

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: fall down and do a faint right there before the altar."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Perhaps, Mrs. Moulton, you would like my friend and me to leave

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the room while you explain this matter?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "If I may give an opinion," remarked the strange gentleman,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "we've had just a little too much secrecy over this business

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: already. For my part, I should like all Europe and America to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: hear the rights of it." He was a small, wiry, sunburnt man,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: clean-shaven, with a sharp face and alert manner.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Then I'll tell our story right away," said the lady. "Frank here

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: and I met in '84, in McQuire's camp, near the Rockies, where pa

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: was working a claim. We were engaged to each other, Frank and I;

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: but then one day father struck a rich pocket and made a pile,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: while poor Frank here had a claim that petered out and came to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: nothing. The richer pa grew the poorer was Frank; so at last pa

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: wouldn't hear of our engagement lasting any longer, and he took

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: me away to 'Frisco. Frank wouldn't throw up his hand, though; so

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: he followed me there, and he saw me without pa knowing anything

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: about it. It would only have made him mad to know, so we just

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: fixed it all up for ourselves. Frank said that he would go and

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: make his pile, too, and never come back to claim me until he had

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: as much as pa. So then I promised to wait for him to the end of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: time and pledged myself not to marry anyone else while he lived.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: 'Why shouldn't we be married right away, then,' said he, 'and

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: then I will feel sure of you; and I won't claim to be your

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: husband until I come back?' Well, we talked it over, and he had

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: fixed it all up so nicely, with a clergyman all ready in waiting,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: that we just did it right there; and then Frank went off to seek

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: his fortune, and I went back to pa.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "The next I heard of Frank was that he was in Montana, and then

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: he went prospecting in Arizona, and then I heard of him from New

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Mexico. After that came a long newspaper story about how a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: miners' camp had been attacked by Apache Indians, and there was

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: my Frank's name among the killed. I fainted dead away, and I was

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: very sick for months after. Pa thought I had a decline and took

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: me to half the doctors in 'Frisco. Not a word of news came for a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: year and more, so that I never doubted that Frank was really

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: dead. Then Lord St. Simon came to 'Frisco, and we came to London,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: and a marriage was arranged, and pa was very pleased, but I felt

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: all the time that no man on this earth would ever take the place

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: in my heart that had been given to my poor Frank.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Still, if I had married Lord St. Simon, of course I'd have done

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: my duty by him. We can't command our love, but we can our

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: actions. I went to the altar with him with the intention to make

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: him just as good a wife as it was in me to be. But you may

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: imagine what I felt when, just as I came to the altar rails, I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: glanced back and saw Frank standing and looking at me out of the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: first pew. I thought it was his ghost at first; but when I looked

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: again there he was still, with a kind of question in his eyes, as

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: if to ask me whether I were glad or sorry to see him. I wonder I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: didn't drop. I know that everything was turning round, and the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: words of the clergyman were just like the buzz of a bee in my

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: ear. I didn't know what to do. Should I stop the service and make

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: a scene in the church? I glanced at him again, and he seemed to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: know what I was thinking, for he raised his finger to his lips to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: tell me to be still. Then I saw him scribble on a piece of paper,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: and I knew that he was writing me a note. As I passed his pew on

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the way out I dropped my bouquet over to him, and he slipped the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: note into my hand when he returned me the flowers. It was only a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: line asking me to join him when he made the sign to me to do so.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Of course I never doubted for a moment that my first duty was now

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: to him, and I determined to do just whatever he might direct.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "When I got back I told my maid, who had known him in California,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: and had always been his friend. I ordered her to say nothing, but

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: to get a few things packed and my ulster ready. I know I ought to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: have spoken to Lord St. Simon, but it was dreadful hard before

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: his mother and all those great people. I just made up my mind to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: run away and explain afterwards. I hadn't been at the table ten

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: minutes before I saw Frank out of the window at the other side of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the road. He beckoned to me and then began walking into the Park.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: I slipped out, put on my things, and followed him. Some woman

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: came talking something or other about Lord St. Simon to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: me--seemed to me from the little I heard as if he had a little

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: secret of his own before marriage also--but I managed to get away

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: from her and soon overtook Frank. We got into a cab together, and

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: away we drove to some lodgings he had taken in Gordon Square, and

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: that was my true wedding after all those years of waiting. Frank

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: had been a prisoner among the Apaches, had escaped, came on to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: 'Frisco, found that I had given him up for dead and had gone to

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: England, followed me there, and had come upon me at last on the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: very morning of my second wedding."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "I saw it in a paper," explained the American. "It gave the name

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: and the church but not where the lady lived."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Then we had a talk as to what we should do, and Frank was all

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: for openness, but I was so ashamed of it all that I felt as if I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: should like to vanish away and never see any of them again--just

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: sending a line to pa, perhaps, to show him that I was alive. It

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: was awful to me to think of all those lords and ladies sitting

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: round that breakfast-table and waiting for me to come back. So

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Frank took my wedding-clothes and things and made a bundle of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: them, so that I should not be traced, and dropped them away

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: somewhere where no one could find them. It is likely that we

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: should have gone on to Paris to-morrow, only that this good

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: gentleman, Mr. Holmes, came round to us this evening, though how

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: he found us is more than I can think, and he showed us very

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: clearly and kindly that I was wrong and that Frank was right, and

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: that we should be putting ourselves in the wrong if we were so

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: secret. Then he offered to give us a chance of talking to Lord

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: St. Simon alone, and so we came right away round to his rooms at

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: once. Now, Robert, you have heard it all, and I am very sorry if

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: I have given you pain, and I hope that you do not think very

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: meanly of me."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Lord St. Simon had by no means relaxed his rigid attitude, but

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: had listened with a frowning brow and a compressed lip to this

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: long narrative.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Excuse me," he said, "but it is not my custom to discuss my most

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: intimate personal affairs in this public manner."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Then you won't forgive me? You won't shake hands before I go?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Oh, certainly, if it would give you any pleasure." He put out

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: his hand and coldly grasped that which she extended to him.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "I had hoped," suggested Holmes, "that you would have joined us

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: in a friendly supper."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "I think that there you ask a little too much," responded his

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Lordship. "I may be forced to acquiesce in these recent

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: developments, but I can hardly be expected to make merry over

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: them. I think that with your permission I will now wish you all a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: very good-night." He included us all in a sweeping bow and

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: stalked out of the room.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "Then I trust that you at least will honour me with your

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: company," said Sherlock Holmes. "It is always a joy to meet an

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: American, Mr. Moulton, for I am one of those who believe that the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: folly of a monarch and the blundering of a minister in far-gone

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: years will not prevent our children from being some day citizens

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: of the same world-wide country under a flag which shall be a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: quartering of the Union Jack with the Stars and Stripes."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "The case has been an interesting one," remarked Holmes when our

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: visitors had left us, "because it serves to show very clearly how

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: simple the explanation may be of an affair which at first sight

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: seems to be almost inexplicable. Nothing could be more natural

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: than the sequence of events as narrated by this lady, and nothing

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: stranger than the result when viewed, for instance, by Mr.

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: Lestrade of Scotland Yard."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "You were not yourself at fault at all, then?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "From the first, two facts were very obvious to me, the one that

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the lady had been quite willing to undergo the wedding ceremony,

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: the other that she had repented of it within a few minutes of

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: returning home. Obviously something had occurred during the

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: morning, then, to cause her to change her mind. What could that

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: something be? She could not have spoken to anyone when she was

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: out, for she had been in the company of the bridegroom. Had she

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: seen someone, then? If she had, it must be someone from America

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: because she had spent so short a time in this country that she

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: could hardly have allowed anyone to acquire so deep an influence

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: over her that the mere sight of him would induce her to change

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: her plans so completely. You see we have already arrived, by a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: process of exclusion, at the idea that she might have seen an

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: American. Then who could this American be, and why should he

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: possess so much influence over her? It might be a lover; it might

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: be a husband. Her young womanhood had, I knew, been spent in

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: rough scenes and under strange conditions. So far I had got

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: before I ever heard Lord St. Simon's narrative. When he told us

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: of a man in a pew, of the change in the bride's manner, of so

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: transparent a device for obtaining a note as the dropping of a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: bouquet, of her resort to her confidential maid, and of her very

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: significant allusion to claim-jumping--which in miners' parlance

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: means taking possession of that which another person has a prior

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: claim to--the whole situation became absolutely clear. She had

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: gone off with a man, and the man was either a lover or was a

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: previous husband--the chances being in favour of the latter."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "And how in the world did you find them?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: NA

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: "It might have been difficult, but friend Lestrade held

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: information in his hands the value of which he did not himself

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: know. The initials were, of course, of the highest importance,

text: but more valuable still was it to know that within a week he had

text: settled his bill at one of the most select London hotels."

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR

text: "How did you deduce the select?"

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR

text: "By the select prices. Eight shillings for a bed and eightpence

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: for a glass of sherry pointed to one of the most expensive

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: In the second one which I visited in Northumberland Avenue, I

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: learned by an inspection of the book that Francis H. Moulton, an

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: over the entries against him, I came upon the very items which I

text: had seen in the duplicate bill. His letters were to be forwarded

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: to 226 Gordon Square; so thither I travelled, and being fortunate

story: X. THE ADVENTURE OF THE NOBLE BACHELOR
text: enough to find the loving couple at home, I ventured to give them

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Holmes," said I as I stood one morning in our bow-window looking

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: down the street, "here is a madman coming along. It seems rather

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: sad that his relatives should allow him to come out alone."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: My friend rose lazily from his armchair and stood with his hands

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in the pockets of his dressing-gown, looking over my shoulder. It

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: was a bright, crisp February morning, and the snow of the day

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: before still lay deep upon the ground, shimmering brightly in the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: wintry sun. Down the centre of Baker Street it had been ploughed

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: into a brown crumbly band by the traffic, but at either side and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: on the heaped-up edges of the foot-paths it still lay as white as

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: when it fell. The grey pavement had been cleaned and scraped, but

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: was still dangerously slippery, so that there were fewer

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: passengers than usual. Indeed, from the direction of the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Metropolitan Station no one was coming save the single gentleman

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: whose eccentric conduct had drawn my attention.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: He was a man of about fifty, tall, portly, and imposing, with a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: massive, strongly marked face and a commanding figure. He was

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: dressed in a sombre yet rich style, in black frock-coat, shining

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hat, neat brown gaiters, and well-cut pearl-grey trousers. Yet

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: his actions were in absurd contrast to the dignity of his dress

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and features, for he was running hard, with occasional little

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: springs, such as a weary man gives who is little accustomed to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: set any tax upon his legs. As he ran he jerked his hands up and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: down, waggled his head, and writhed his face into the most

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: extraordinary contortions.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "What on earth can be the matter with him?" I asked. "He is

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: looking up at the numbers of the houses."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I believe that he is coming here," said Holmes, rubbing his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hands.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Here?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Yes; I rather think he is coming to consult me professionally. I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: think that I recognise the symptoms. Ha! did I not tell you?" As

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he spoke, the man, puffing and blowing, rushed at our door and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: pulled at our bell until the whole house resounded with the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: clanging.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: A few moments later he was in our room, still puffing, still

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: gesticulating, but with so fixed a look of grief and despair in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: his eyes that our smiles were turned in an instant to horror and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: pity. For a while he could not get his words out, but swayed his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: body and plucked at his hair like one who has been driven to the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: extreme limits of his reason. Then, suddenly springing to his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: feet, he beat his head against the wall with such force that we

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: both rushed upon him and tore him away to the centre of the room.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Sherlock Holmes pushed him down into the easy-chair and, sitting

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: beside him, patted his hand and chatted with him in the easy,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: soothing tones which he knew so well how to employ.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You have come to me to tell your story, have you not?" said he.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You are fatigued with your haste. Pray wait until you have

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: recovered yourself, and then I shall be most happy to look into

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: any little problem which you may submit to me."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: The man sat for a minute or more with a heaving chest, fighting

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: against his emotion. Then he passed his handkerchief over his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: brow, set his lips tight, and turned his face towards us.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "No doubt you think me mad?" said he.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I see that you have had some great trouble," responded Holmes.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "God knows I have!--a trouble which is enough to unseat my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: reason, so sudden and so terrible is it. Public disgrace I might

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: have faced, although I am a man whose character has never yet

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: borne a stain. Private affliction also is the lot of every man;

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: but the two coming together, and in so frightful a form, have

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: been enough to shake my very soul. Besides, it is not I alone.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: The very noblest in the land may suffer unless some way be found

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: out of this horrible affair."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Pray compose yourself, sir," said Holmes, "and let me have a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: clear account of who you are and what it is that has befallen

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: you."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "My name," answered our visitor, "is probably familiar to your

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: ears. I am Alexander Holder, of the banking firm of Holder &

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Stevenson, of Threadneedle Street."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: The name was indeed well known to us as belonging to the senior

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: partner in the second largest private banking concern in the City

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: of London. What could have happened, then, to bring one of the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: foremost citizens of London to this most pitiable pass? We

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: waited, all curiosity, until with another effort he braced

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: himself to tell his story.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I feel that time is of value," said he; "that is why I hastened

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: here when the police inspector suggested that I should secure

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: your co-operation. I came to Baker Street by the Underground and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hurried from there on foot, for the cabs go slowly through this

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: snow. That is why I was so out of breath, for I am a man who

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: takes very little exercise. I feel better now, and I will put the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: facts before you as shortly and yet as clearly as I can.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "It is, of course, well known to you that in a successful banking

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: business as much depends upon our being able to find remunerative

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: investments for our funds as upon our increasing our connection

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and the number of our depositors. One of our most lucrative means

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: of laying out money is in the shape of loans, where the security

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: is unimpeachable. We have done a good deal in this direction

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: during the last few years, and there are many noble families to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: whom we have advanced large sums upon the security of their

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: pictures, libraries, or plate.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Yesterday morning I was seated in my office at the bank when a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: card was brought in to me by one of the clerks. I started when I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: saw the name, for it was that of none other than--well, perhaps

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: even to you I had better say no more than that it was a name

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: which is a household word all over the earth--one of the highest,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: noblest, most exalted names in England. I was overwhelmed by the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: honour and attempted, when he entered, to say so, but he plunged

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: at once into business with the air of a man who wishes to hurry

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: quickly through a disagreeable task.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Mr. Holder,' said he, 'I have been informed that you are in the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: habit of advancing money.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'The firm does so when the security is good.' I answered.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'It is absolutely essential to me,' said he, 'that I should have

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: 50,000 pounds at once. I could, of course, borrow so trifling a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: sum ten times over from my friends, but I much prefer to make it

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: a matter of business and to carry out that business myself. In my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: position you can readily understand that it is unwise to place

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: one's self under obligations.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'For how long, may I ask, do you want this sum?' I asked.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Next Monday I have a large sum due to me, and I shall then most

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: certainly repay what you advance, with whatever interest you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: think it right to charge. But it is very essential to me that the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: money should be paid at once.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'I should be happy to advance it without further parley from my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: own private purse,' said I, 'were it not that the strain would be

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: rather more than it could bear. If, on the other hand, I am to do

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: it in the name of the firm, then in justice to my partner I must

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: insist that, even in your case, every businesslike precaution

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: should be taken.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'I should much prefer to have it so,' said he, raising up a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: square, black morocco case which he had laid beside his chair.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: 'You have doubtless heard of the Beryl Coronet?'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'One of the most precious public possessions of the empire,'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: said I.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Precisely.' He opened the case, and there, imbedded in soft,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: flesh-coloured velvet, lay the magnificent piece of jewellery

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: which he had named. 'There are thirty-nine enormous beryls,' said

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he, 'and the price of the gold chasing is incalculable. The

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: lowest estimate would put the worth of the coronet at double the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: sum which I have asked. I am prepared to leave it with you as my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: security.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I took the precious case into my hands and looked in some

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: perplexity from it to my illustrious client.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'You doubt its value?' he asked.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Not at all. I only doubt--'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'The propriety of my leaving it. You may set your mind at rest

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: about that. I should not dream of doing so were it not absolutely

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: certain that I should be able in four days to reclaim it. It is a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: pure matter of form. Is the security sufficient?'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Ample.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'You understand, Mr. Holder, that I am giving you a strong proof

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: of the confidence which I have in you, founded upon all that I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: have heard of you. I rely upon you not only to be discreet and to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: refrain from all gossip upon the matter but, above all, to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: preserve this coronet with every possible precaution because I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: need not say that a great public scandal would be caused if any

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: harm were to befall it. Any injury to it would be almost as

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: serious as its complete loss, for there are no beryls in the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: world to match these, and it would be impossible to replace them.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: I leave it with you, however, with every confidence, and I shall

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: call for it in person on Monday morning.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Seeing that my client was anxious to leave, I said no more but,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: calling for my cashier, I ordered him to pay over fifty 1000

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: pound notes. When I was alone once more, however, with the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: precious case lying upon the table in front of me, I could not

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: but think with some misgivings of the immense responsibility

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: which it entailed upon me. There could be no doubt that, as it

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: was a national possession, a horrible scandal would ensue if any

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: misfortune should occur to it. I already regretted having ever

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: consented to take charge of it. However, it was too late to alter

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the matter now, so I locked it up in my private safe and turned

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: once more to my work.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "When evening came I felt that it would be an imprudence to leave

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: so precious a thing in the office behind me. Bankers' safes had

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: been forced before now, and why should not mine be? If so, how

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: terrible would be the position in which I should find myself! I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: determined, therefore, that for the next few days I would always

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: carry the case backward and forward with me, so that it might

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: never be really out of my reach. With this intention, I called a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: cab and drove out to my house at Streatham, carrying the jewel

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: with me. I did not breathe freely until I had taken it upstairs

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and locked it in the bureau of my dressing-room.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "And now a word as to my household, Mr. Holmes, for I wish you to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: thoroughly understand the situation. My groom and my page sleep

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: out of the house, and may be set aside altogether. I have three

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: maid-servants who have been with me a number of years and whose

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: absolute reliability is quite above suspicion. Another, Lucy

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Parr, the second waiting-maid, has only been in my service a few

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: months. She came with an excellent character, however, and has

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: always given me satisfaction. She is a very pretty girl and has

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: attracted admirers who have occasionally hung about the place.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: That is the only drawback which we have found to her, but we

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: believe her to be a thoroughly good girl in every way.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "So much for the servants. My family itself is so small that it

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: will not take me long to describe it. I am a widower and have an

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: only son, Arthur. He has been a disappointment to me, Mr.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Holmes--a grievous disappointment. I have no doubt that I am

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: myself to blame. People tell me that I have spoiled him. Very

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: likely I have. When my dear wife died I felt that he was all I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: had to love. I could not bear to see the smile fade even for a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: moment from his face. I have never denied him a wish. Perhaps it

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: would have been better for both of us had I been sterner, but I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: meant it for the best.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "It was naturally my intention that he should succeed me in my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: business, but he was not of a business turn. He was wild,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: wayward, and, to speak the truth, I could not trust him in the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: handling of large sums of money. When he was young he became a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: member of an aristocratic club, and there, having charming

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: manners, he was soon the intimate of a number of men with long

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: purses and expensive habits. He learned to play heavily at cards

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and to squander money on the turf, until he had again and again

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: to come to me and implore me to give him an advance upon his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: allowance, that he might settle his debts of honour. He tried

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: more than once to break away from the dangerous company which he

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: was keeping, but each time the influence of his friend, Sir

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: George Burnwell, was enough to draw him back again.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "And, indeed, I could not wonder that such a man as Sir George

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Burnwell should gain an influence over him, for he has frequently

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: brought him to my house, and I have found myself that I could
