story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hardly resist the fascination of his manner. He is older than

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Arthur, a man of the world to his finger-tips, one who had been

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: everywhere, seen everything, a brilliant talker, and a man of

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: great personal beauty. Yet when I think of him in cold blood, far

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: away from the glamour of his presence, I am convinced from his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: cynical speech and the look which I have caught in his eyes that

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he is one who should be deeply distrusted. So I think, and so,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: too, thinks my little Mary, who has a woman's quick insight into

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: character.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "And now there is only she to be described. She is my niece; but

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: when my brother died five years ago and left her alone in the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: world I adopted her, and have looked upon her ever since as my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: daughter. She is a sunbeam in my house--sweet, loving, beautiful,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: a wonderful manager and housekeeper, yet as tender and quiet and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: gentle as a woman could be. She is my right hand. I do not know

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: what I could do without her. In only one matter has she ever gone

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: against my wishes. Twice my boy has asked her to marry him, for

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he loves her devotedly, but each time she has refused him. I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: think that if anyone could have drawn him into the right path it

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: would have been she, and that his marriage might have changed his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: whole life; but now, alas! it is too late--forever too late!

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Now, Mr. Holmes, you know the people who live under my roof, and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: I shall continue with my miserable story.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "When we were taking coffee in the drawing-room that night after

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: dinner, I told Arthur and Mary my experience, and of the precious

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: treasure which we had under our roof, suppressing only the name

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: of my client. Lucy Parr, who had brought in the coffee, had, I am

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: sure, left the room; but I cannot swear that the door was closed.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Mary and Arthur were much interested and wished to see the famous

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: coronet, but I thought it better not to disturb it.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Where have you put it?' asked Arthur.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'In my own bureau.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Well, I hope to goodness the house won't be burgled during the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: night.' said he.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'It is locked up,' I answered.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Oh, any old key will fit that bureau. When I was a youngster I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: have opened it myself with the key of the box-room cupboard.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "He often had a wild way of talking, so that I thought little of

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: what he said. He followed me to my room, however, that night with

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: a very grave face.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Look here, dad,' said he with his eyes cast down, 'can you let

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: me have 200 pounds?'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'No, I cannot!' I answered sharply. 'I have been far too

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: generous with you in money matters.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'You have been very kind,' said he, 'but I must have this money,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: or else I can never show my face inside the club again.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'And a very good thing, too!' I cried.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Yes, but you would not have me leave it a dishonoured man,'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: said he. 'I could not bear the disgrace. I must raise the money

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in some way, and if you will not let me have it, then I must try

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: other means.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I was very angry, for this was the third demand during the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: month. 'You shall not have a farthing from me,' I cried, on which

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he bowed and left the room without another word.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "When he was gone I unlocked my bureau, made sure that my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: treasure was safe, and locked it again. Then I started to go

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: round the house to see that all was secure--a duty which I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: usually leave to Mary but which I thought it well to perform

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: myself that night. As I came down the stairs I saw Mary herself

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: at the side window of the hall, which she closed and fastened as

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: I approached.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Tell me, dad,' said she, looking, I thought, a little

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: disturbed, 'did you give Lucy, the maid, leave to go out

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: to-night?'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Certainly not.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'She came in just now by the back door. I have no doubt that she

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: has only been to the side gate to see someone, but I think that

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: it is hardly safe and should be stopped.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'You must speak to her in the morning, or I will if you prefer

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: it. Are you sure that everything is fastened?'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Quite sure, dad.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Then, good-night.' I kissed her and went up to my bedroom

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: again, where I was soon asleep.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I am endeavouring to tell you everything, Mr. Holmes, which may

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: have any bearing upon the case, but I beg that you will question

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: me upon any point which I do not make clear."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "On the contrary, your statement is singularly lucid."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I come to a part of my story now in which I should wish to be

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: particularly so. I am not a very heavy sleeper, and the anxiety

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in my mind tended, no doubt, to make me even less so than usual.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: About two in the morning, then, I was awakened by some sound in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the house. It had ceased ere I was wide awake, but it had left an

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: impression behind it as though a window had gently closed

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: somewhere. I lay listening with all my ears. Suddenly, to my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: horror, there was a distinct sound of footsteps moving softly in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the next room. I slipped out of bed, all palpitating with fear,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and peeped round the corner of my dressing-room door.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Arthur!' I screamed, 'you villain! you thief! How dare you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: touch that coronet?'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "The gas was half up, as I had left it, and my unhappy boy,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: dressed only in his shirt and trousers, was standing beside the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: light, holding the coronet in his hands. He appeared to be

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: wrenching at it, or bending it with all his strength. At my cry

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he dropped it from his grasp and turned as pale as death. I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: snatched it up and examined it. One of the gold corners, with

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: three of the beryls in it, was missing.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'You blackguard!' I shouted, beside myself with rage. 'You have

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: destroyed it! You have dishonoured me forever! Where are the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: jewels which you have stolen?'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Stolen!' he cried.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Yes, thief!' I roared, shaking him by the shoulder.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'There are none missing. There cannot be any missing,' said he.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'There are three missing. And you know where they are. Must I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: call you a liar as well as a thief? Did I not see you trying to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: tear off another piece?'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'You have called me names enough,' said he, 'I will not stand it

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: any longer. I shall not say another word about this business,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: since you have chosen to insult me. I will leave your house in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the morning and make my own way in the world.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'You shall leave it in the hands of the police!' I cried

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: half-mad with grief and rage. 'I shall have this matter probed to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the bottom.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'You shall learn nothing from me,' said he with a passion such

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: as I should not have thought was in his nature. 'If you choose to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: call the police, let the police find what they can.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "By this time the whole house was astir, for I had raised my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: voice in my anger. Mary was the first to rush into my room, and,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: at the sight of the coronet and of Arthur's face, she read the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: whole story and, with a scream, fell down senseless on the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: ground. I sent the house-maid for the police and put the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: investigation into their hands at once. When the inspector and a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: constable entered the house, Arthur, who had stood sullenly with

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: his arms folded, asked me whether it was my intention to charge

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: him with theft. I answered that it had ceased to be a private

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: matter, but had become a public one, since the ruined coronet was

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: national property. I was determined that the law should have its

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: way in everything.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'At least,' said he, 'you will not have me arrested at once. It

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: would be to your advantage as well as mine if I might leave the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: house for five minutes.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'That you may get away, or perhaps that you may conceal what you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: have stolen,' said I. And then, realising the dreadful position

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in which I was placed, I implored him to remember that not only

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: my honour but that of one who was far greater than I was at

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: stake; and that he threatened to raise a scandal which would

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: convulse the nation. He might avert it all if he would but tell

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: me what he had done with the three missing stones.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'You may as well face the matter,' said I; 'you have been caught

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in the act, and no confession could make your guilt more heinous.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: If you but make such reparation as is in your power, by telling

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: us where the beryls are, all shall be forgiven and forgotten.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'Keep your forgiveness for those who ask for it,' he answered,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: turning away from me with a sneer. I saw that he was too hardened

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: for any words of mine to influence him. There was but one way for

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: it. I called in the inspector and gave him into custody. A search

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: was made at once not only of his person but of his room and of

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: every portion of the house where he could possibly have concealed

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the gems; but no trace of them could be found, nor would the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: wretched boy open his mouth for all our persuasions and our

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: threats. This morning he was removed to a cell, and I, after

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: going through all the police formalities, have hurried round to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: you to implore you to use your skill in unravelling the matter.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: The police have openly confessed that they can at present make

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: nothing of it. You may go to any expense which you think

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: necessary. I have already offered a reward of 1000 pounds. My

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: God, what shall I do! I have lost my honour, my gems, and my son

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in one night. Oh, what shall I do!"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: He put a hand on either side of his head and rocked himself to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and fro, droning to himself like a child whose grief has got

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: beyond words.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Sherlock Holmes sat silent for some few minutes, with his brows

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: knitted and his eyes fixed upon the fire.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Do you receive much company?" he asked.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "None save my partner with his family and an occasional friend of

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Arthur's. Sir George Burnwell has been several times lately. No

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: one else, I think."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Do you go out much in society?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Arthur does. Mary and I stay at home. We neither of us care for

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: it."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "That is unusual in a young girl."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "She is of a quiet nature. Besides, she is not so very young. She

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: is four-and-twenty."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "This matter, from what you say, seems to have been a shock to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: her also."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Terrible! She is even more affected than I."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You have neither of you any doubt as to your son's guilt?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "How can we have when I saw him with my own eyes with the coronet

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in his hands."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I hardly consider that a conclusive proof. Was the remainder of

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the coronet at all injured?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Yes, it was twisted."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Do you not think, then, that he might have been trying to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: straighten it?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "God bless you! You are doing what you can for him and for me.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: But it is too heavy a task. What was he doing there at all? If

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: his purpose were innocent, why did he not say so?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Precisely. And if it were guilty, why did he not invent a lie?

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: His silence appears to me to cut both ways. There are several

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: singular points about the case. What did the police think of the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: noise which awoke you from your sleep?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "They considered that it might be caused by Arthur's closing his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: bedroom door."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "A likely story! As if a man bent on felony would slam his door

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: so as to wake a household. What did they say, then, of the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: disappearance of these gems?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "They are still sounding the planking and probing the furniture

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in the hope of finding them."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Have they thought of looking outside the house?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Yes, they have shown extraordinary energy. The whole garden has

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: already been minutely examined."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Now, my dear sir," said Holmes, "is it not obvious to you now

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: that this matter really strikes very much deeper than either you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: or the police were at first inclined to think? It appeared to you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: to be a simple case; to me it seems exceedingly complex. Consider

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: what is involved by your theory. You suppose that your son came

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: down from his bed, went, at great risk, to your dressing-room,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: opened your bureau, took out your coronet, broke off by main

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: force a small portion of it, went off to some other place,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: concealed three gems out of the thirty-nine, with such skill that

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: nobody can find them, and then returned with the other thirty-six

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: into the room in which he exposed himself to the greatest danger

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: of being discovered. I ask you now, is such a theory tenable?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "But what other is there?" cried the banker with a gesture of

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: despair. "If his motives were innocent, why does he not explain

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: them?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "It is our task to find that out," replied Holmes; "so now, if

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: you please, Mr. Holder, we will set off for Streatham together,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and devote an hour to glancing a little more closely into

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: details."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: My friend insisted upon my accompanying them in their expedition,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: which I was eager enough to do, for my curiosity and sympathy

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: were deeply stirred by the story to which we had listened. I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: confess that the guilt of the banker's son appeared to me to be

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: as obvious as it did to his unhappy father, but still I had such

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: faith in Holmes' judgment that I felt that there must be some

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: grounds for hope as long as he was dissatisfied with the accepted

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: explanation. He hardly spoke a word the whole way out to the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: southern suburb, but sat with his chin upon his breast and his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hat drawn over his eyes, sunk in the deepest thought. Our client

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: appeared to have taken fresh heart at the little glimpse of hope

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: which had been presented to him, and he even broke into a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: desultory chat with me over his business affairs. A short railway

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: journey and a shorter walk brought us to Fairbank, the modest

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: residence of the great financier.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Fairbank was a good-sized square house of white stone, standing

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: back a little from the road. A double carriage-sweep, with a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: snow-clad lawn, stretched down in front to two large iron gates

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: which closed the entrance. On the right side was a small wooden

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: thicket, which led into a narrow path between two neat hedges

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: stretching from the road to the kitchen door, and forming the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: tradesmen's entrance. On the left ran a lane which led to the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: stables, and was not itself within the grounds at all, being a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: public, though little used, thoroughfare. Holmes left us standing

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: at the door and walked slowly all round the house, across the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: front, down the tradesmen's path, and so round by the garden

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: behind into the stable lane. So long was he that Mr. Holder and I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: went into the dining-room and waited by the fire until he should

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: return. We were sitting there in silence when the door opened and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: a young lady came in. She was rather above the middle height,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: slim, with dark hair and eyes, which seemed the darker against

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the absolute pallor of her skin. I do not think that I have ever

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: seen such deadly paleness in a woman's face. Her lips, too, were

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: bloodless, but her eyes were flushed with crying. As she swept

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: silently into the room she impressed me with a greater sense of

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: grief than the banker had done in the morning, and it was the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: more striking in her as she was evidently a woman of strong

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: character, with immense capacity for self-restraint. Disregarding

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: my presence, she went straight to her uncle and passed her hand

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: over his head with a sweet womanly caress.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You have given orders that Arthur should be liberated, have you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: not, dad?" she asked.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "No, no, my girl, the matter must be probed to the bottom."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "But I am so sure that he is innocent. You know what woman's

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: instincts are. I know that he has done no harm and that you will

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: be sorry for having acted so harshly."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Why is he silent, then, if he is innocent?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Who knows? Perhaps because he was so angry that you should

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: suspect him."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "How could I help suspecting him, when I actually saw him with

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the coronet in his hand?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Oh, but he had only picked it up to look at it. Oh, do, do take

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: my word for it that he is innocent. Let the matter drop and say

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: no more. It is so dreadful to think of our dear Arthur in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: prison!"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I shall never let it drop until the gems are found--never, Mary!

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Your affection for Arthur blinds you as to the awful consequences

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: to me. Far from hushing the thing up, I have brought a gentleman

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: down from London to inquire more deeply into it."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "This gentleman?" she asked, facing round to me.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "No, his friend. He wished us to leave him alone. He is round in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the stable lane now."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "The stable lane?" She raised her dark eyebrows. "What can he

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hope to find there? Ah! this, I suppose, is he. I trust, sir,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: that you will succeed in proving, what I feel sure is the truth,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: that my cousin Arthur is innocent of this crime."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I fully share your opinion, and I trust, with you, that we may

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: prove it," returned Holmes, going back to the mat to knock the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: snow from his shoes. "I believe I have the honour of addressing

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Miss Mary Holder. Might I ask you a question or two?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Pray do, sir, if it may help to clear this horrible affair up."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You heard nothing yourself last night?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Nothing, until my uncle here began to speak loudly. I heard

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: that, and I came down."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You shut up the windows and doors the night before. Did you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: fasten all the windows?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Yes."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Were they all fastened this morning?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Yes."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You have a maid who has a sweetheart? I think that you remarked

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: to your uncle last night that she had been out to see him?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Yes, and she was the girl who waited in the drawing-room, and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: who may have heard uncle's remarks about the coronet."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I see. You infer that she may have gone out to tell her

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: sweetheart, and that the two may have planned the robbery."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "But what is the good of all these vague theories," cried the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: banker impatiently, "when I have told you that I saw Arthur with

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the coronet in his hands?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Wait a little, Mr. Holder. We must come back to that. About this

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: girl, Miss Holder. You saw her return by the kitchen door, I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: presume?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Yes; when I went to see if the door was fastened for the night I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: met her slipping in. I saw the man, too, in the gloom."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Do you know him?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Oh, yes! he is the green-grocer who brings our vegetables round.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: His name is Francis Prosper."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "He stood," said Holmes, "to the left of the door--that is to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: say, farther up the path than is necessary to reach the door?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Yes, he did."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "And he is a man with a wooden leg?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Something like fear sprang up in the young lady's expressive

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: black eyes. "Why, you are like a magician," said she. "How do you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: know that?" She smiled, but there was no answering smile in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Holmes' thin, eager face.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I should be very glad now to go upstairs," said he. "I shall

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: probably wish to go over the outside of the house again. Perhaps

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: I had better take a look at the lower windows before I go up."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: He walked swiftly round from one to the other, pausing only at

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the large one which looked from the hall onto the stable lane.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: This he opened and made a very careful examination of the sill

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: with his powerful magnifying lens. "Now we shall go upstairs,"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: said he at last.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: The banker's dressing-room was a plainly furnished little

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: chamber, with a grey carpet, a large bureau, and a long mirror.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Holmes went to the bureau first and looked hard at the lock.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Which key was used to open it?" he asked.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "That which my son himself indicated--that of the cupboard of the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: lumber-room."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Have you it here?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "That is it on the dressing-table."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Sherlock Holmes took it up and opened the bureau.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "It is a noiseless lock," said he. "It is no wonder that it did

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: not wake you. This case, I presume, contains the coronet. We must

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: have a look at it." He opened the case, and taking out the diadem

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he laid it upon the table. It was a magnificent specimen of the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: jeweller's art, and the thirty-six stones were the finest that I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: have ever seen. At one side of the coronet was a cracked edge,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: where a corner holding three gems had been torn away.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Now, Mr. Holder," said Holmes, "here is the corner which

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: corresponds to that which has been so unfortunately lost. Might I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: beg that you will break it off."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: The banker recoiled in horror. "I should not dream of trying,"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: said he.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Then I will." Holmes suddenly bent his strength upon it, but

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: without result. "I feel it give a little," said he; "but, though

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: I am exceptionally strong in the fingers, it would take me all my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: time to break it. An ordinary man could not do it. Now, what do

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: you think would happen if I did break it, Mr. Holder? There would

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: be a noise like a pistol shot. Do you tell me that all this

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: happened within a few yards of your bed and that you heard

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: nothing of it?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I do not know what to think. It is all dark to me."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "But perhaps it may grow lighter as we go. What do you think,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Miss Holder?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I confess that I still share my uncle's perplexity."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Your son had no shoes or slippers on when you saw him?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "He had nothing on save only his trousers and shirt."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Thank you. We have certainly been favoured with extraordinary

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: luck during this inquiry, and it will be entirely our own fault

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: if we do not succeed in clearing the matter up. With your

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: permission, Mr. Holder, I shall now continue my investigations

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: outside."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: He went alone, at his own request, for he explained that any

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: unnecessary footmarks might make his task more difficult. For an

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hour or more he was at work, returning at last with his feet

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: heavy with snow and his features as inscrutable as ever.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I think that I have seen now all that there is to see, Mr.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Holder," said he; "I can serve you best by returning to my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: rooms."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "But the gems, Mr. Holmes. Where are they?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I cannot tell."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: The banker wrung his hands. "I shall never see them again!" he

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: cried. "And my son? You give me hopes?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "My opinion is in no way altered."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Then, for God's sake, what was this dark business which was

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: acted in my house last night?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "If you can call upon me at my Baker Street rooms to-morrow

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: morning between nine and ten I shall be happy to do what I can to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: make it clearer. I understand that you give me carte blanche to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: act for you, provided only that I get back the gems, and that you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: place no limit on the sum I may draw."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I would give my fortune to have them back."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Very good. I shall look into the matter between this and then.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Good-bye; it is just possible that I may have to come over here

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: again before evening."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: It was obvious to me that my companion's mind was now made up

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: about the case, although what his conclusions were was more than

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: I could even dimly imagine. Several times during our homeward

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: journey I endeavoured to sound him upon the point, but he always

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: glided away to some other topic, until at last I gave it over in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: despair. It was not yet three when we found ourselves in our

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: rooms once more. He hurried to his chamber and was down again in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: a few minutes dressed as a common loafer. With his collar turned

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: up, his shiny, seedy coat, his red cravat, and his worn boots, he

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: was a perfect sample of the class.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I think that this should do," said he, glancing into the glass

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: above the fireplace. "I only wish that you could come with me,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Watson, but I fear that it won't do. I may be on the trail in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: this matter, or I may be following a will-o'-the-wisp, but I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: shall soon know which it is. I hope that I may be back in a few

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hours." He cut a slice of beef from the joint upon the sideboard,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: sandwiched it between two rounds of bread, and thrusting this

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: rude meal into his pocket he started off upon his expedition.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: I had just finished my tea when he returned, evidently in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: excellent spirits, swinging an old elastic-sided boot in his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hand. He chucked it down into a corner and helped himself to a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: cup of tea.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I only looked in as I passed," said he. "I am going right on."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Where to?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Oh, to the other side of the West End. It may be some time

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: before I get back. Don't wait up for me in case I should be

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: late."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "How are you getting on?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Oh, so so. Nothing to complain of. I have been out to Streatham

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: since I saw you last, but I did not call at the house. It is a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: very sweet little problem, and I would not have missed it for a

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: good deal. However, I must not sit gossiping here, but must get

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: these disreputable clothes off and return to my highly

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: respectable self."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: I could see by his manner that he had stronger reasons for

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: satisfaction than his words alone would imply. His eyes twinkled,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and there was even a touch of colour upon his sallow cheeks. He

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hastened upstairs, and a few minutes later I heard the slam of

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the hall door, which told me that he was off once more upon his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: congenial hunt.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: I waited until midnight, but there was no sign of his return, so

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: I retired to my room. It was no uncommon thing for him to be away

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: for days and nights on end when he was hot upon a scent, so that

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: his lateness caused me no surprise. I do not know at what hour he

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: came in, but when I came down to breakfast in the morning there

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he was with a cup of coffee in one hand and the paper in the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: other, as fresh and trim as possible.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You will excuse my beginning without you, Watson," said he, "but

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: you remember that our client has rather an early appointment this

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: morning."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Why, it is after nine now," I answered. "I should not be

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: surprised if that were he. I thought I heard a ring."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: It was, indeed, our friend the financier. I was shocked by the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: change which had come over him, for his face which was naturally

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: of a broad and massive mould, was now pinched and fallen in,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: while his hair seemed to me at least a shade whiter. He entered

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: with a weariness and lethargy which was even more painful than

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: his violence of the morning before, and he dropped heavily into

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the armchair which I pushed forward for him.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I do not know what I have done to be so severely tried," said

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he. "Only two days ago I was a happy and prosperous man, without

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: a care in the world. Now I am left to a lonely and dishonoured

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: age. One sorrow comes close upon the heels of another. My niece,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Mary, has deserted me."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Deserted you?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Yes. Her bed this morning had not been slept in, her room was

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: empty, and a note for me lay upon the hall table. I had said to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: her last night, in sorrow and not in anger, that if she had

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: married my boy all might have been well with him. Perhaps it was

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: thoughtless of me to say so. It is to that remark that she refers

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in this note:

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "'MY DEAREST UNCLE:--I feel that I have brought trouble upon you,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and that if I had acted differently this terrible misfortune

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: might never have occurred. I cannot, with this thought in my

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: mind, ever again be happy under your roof, and I feel that I must

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: leave you forever. Do not worry about my future, for that is

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: provided for; and, above all, do not search for me, for it will

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: be fruitless labour and an ill-service to me. In life or in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: death, I am ever your loving,--MARY.'

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "What could she mean by that note, Mr. Holmes? Do you think it

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: points to suicide?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "No, no, nothing of the kind. It is perhaps the best possible

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: solution. I trust, Mr. Holder, that you are nearing the end of

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: your troubles."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Ha! You say so! You have heard something, Mr. Holmes; you have

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: learned something! Where are the gems?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You would not think 1000 pounds apiece an excessive sum for

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: them?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I would pay ten."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "That would be unnecessary. Three thousand will cover the matter.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: And there is a little reward, I fancy. Have you your check-book?

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Here is a pen. Better make it out for 4000 pounds."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: With a dazed face the banker made out the required check. Holmes

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: walked over to his desk, took out a little triangular piece of

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: gold with three gems in it, and threw it down upon the table.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: With a shriek of joy our client clutched it up.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You have it!" he gasped. "I am saved! I am saved!"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: The reaction of joy was as passionate as his grief had been, and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he hugged his recovered gems to his bosom.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "There is one other thing you owe, Mr. Holder," said Sherlock

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Holmes rather sternly.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Owe!" He caught up a pen. "Name the sum, and I will pay it."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "No, the debt is not to me. You owe a very humble apology to that

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: noble lad, your son, who has carried himself in this matter as I

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: should be proud to see my own son do, should I ever chance to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: have one."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Then it was not Arthur who took them?"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I told you yesterday, and I repeat to-day, that it was not."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You are sure of it! Then let us hurry to him at once to let him

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: know that the truth is known."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "He knows it already. When I had cleared it all up I had an

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: interview with him, and finding that he would not tell me the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: story, I told it to him, on which he had to confess that I was

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: right and to add the very few details which were not yet quite

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: clear to me. Your news of this morning, however, may open his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: lips."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "For heaven's sake, tell me, then, what is this extraordinary

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: mystery!"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I will do so, and I will show you the steps by which I reached

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: it. And let me say to you, first, that which it is hardest for me

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: to say and for you to hear: there has been an understanding

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: between Sir George Burnwell and your niece Mary. They have now

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: fled together."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "My Mary? Impossible!"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "It is unfortunately more than possible; it is certain. Neither

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: you nor your son knew the true character of this man when you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: admitted him into your family circle. He is one of the most

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: dangerous men in England--a ruined gambler, an absolutely

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: desperate villain, a man without heart or conscience. Your niece

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: knew nothing of such men. When he breathed his vows to her, as he

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: had done to a hundred before her, she flattered herself that she

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: alone had touched his heart. The devil knows best what he said,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: but at least she became his tool and was in the habit of seeing

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: him nearly every evening."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I cannot, and I will not, believe it!" cried the banker with an

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: ashen face.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "I will tell you, then, what occurred in your house last night.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Your niece, when you had, as she thought, gone to your room,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: slipped down and talked to her lover through the window which

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: leads into the stable lane. His footmarks had pressed right

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: through the snow, so long had he stood there. She told him of the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: coronet. His wicked lust for gold kindled at the news, and he

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: bent her to his will. I have no doubt that she loved you, but

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: there are women in whom the love of a lover extinguishes all

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: other loves, and I think that she must have been one. She had

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hardly listened to his instructions when she saw you coming

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: downstairs, on which she closed the window rapidly and told you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: about one of the servants' escapade with her wooden-legged lover,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: which was all perfectly true.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Your boy, Arthur, went to bed after his interview with you but

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he slept badly on account of his uneasiness about his club debts.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: In the middle of the night he heard a soft tread pass his door,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: so he rose and, looking out, was surprised to see his cousin

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: walking very stealthily along the passage until she disappeared

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: into your dressing-room. Petrified with astonishment, the lad

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: slipped on some clothes and waited there in the dark to see what

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: would come of this strange affair. Presently she emerged from the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: room again, and in the light of the passage-lamp your son saw

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: that she carried the precious coronet in her hands. She passed

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: down the stairs, and he, thrilling with horror, ran along and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: slipped behind the curtain near your door, whence he could see

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: what passed in the hall beneath. He saw her stealthily open the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: window, hand out the coronet to someone in the gloom, and then

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: closing it once more hurry back to her room, passing quite close

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: to where he stood hid behind the curtain.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "As long as she was on the scene he could not take any action

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: without a horrible exposure of the woman whom he loved. But the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: instant that she was gone he realised how crushing a misfortune

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: this would be for you, and how all-important it was to set it

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: right. He rushed down, just as he was, in his bare feet, opened

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the window, sprang out into the snow, and ran down the lane,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: where he could see a dark figure in the moonlight. Sir George

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: Burnwell tried to get away, but Arthur caught him, and there was

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: a struggle between them, your lad tugging at one side of the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: coronet, and his opponent at the other. In the scuffle, your son

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: struck Sir George and cut him over the eye. Then something

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: suddenly snapped, and your son, finding that he had the coronet

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in his hands, rushed back, closed the window, ascended to your

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: room, and had just observed that the coronet had been twisted in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the struggle and was endeavouring to straighten it when you

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: appeared upon the scene."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Is it possible?" gasped the banker.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "You then roused his anger by calling him names at a moment when

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: he felt that he had deserved your warmest thanks. He could not

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: explain the true state of affairs without betraying one who

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: certainly deserved little enough consideration at his hands. He

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: took the more chivalrous view, however, and preserved her

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: secret."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "And that was why she shrieked and fainted when she saw the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: coronet," cried Mr. Holder. "Oh, my God! what a blind fool I have

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: been! And his asking to be allowed to go out for five minutes!

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: The dear fellow wanted to see if the missing piece were at the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: scene of the struggle. How cruelly I have misjudged him!"

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: NA

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "When I arrived at the house," continued Holmes, "I at once went

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: very carefully round it to observe if there were any traces in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the snow which might help me. I knew that none had fallen since

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the evening before, and also that there had been a strong frost

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: to preserve impressions. I passed along the tradesmen's path, but

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: found it all trampled down and indistinguishable. Just beyond it,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: however, at the far side of the kitchen door, a woman had stood

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and talked with a man, whose round impressions on one side showed

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: that he had a wooden leg. I could even tell that they had been

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "There was a double line of tracks of a booted man, and a second

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: double line which I saw with delight belonged to a man with naked

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: feet. I was at once convinced from what you had told me that the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: other had run swiftly, and as his tread was marked in places over

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the depression of the boot, it was obvious that he had passed

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: after the other. I followed them up and found they led to the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hall window, where Boots had worn all the snow away while

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: waiting. Then I walked to the other end, which was a hundred

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: yards or more down the lane. I saw where Boots had faced round,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: where the snow was cut up as though there had been a struggle,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: another little smudge of blood showed that it was he who had been

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: hurt. When he came to the highroad at the other end, I found that

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the pavement had been cleared, so there was an end to that clue.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "On entering the house, however, I examined, as you remember, the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: sill and framework of the hall window with my lens, and I could

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: in. I was then beginning to be able to form an opinion as to what

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: had occurred. A man had waited outside the window; someone had

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: brought the gems; the deed had been overseen by your son; he had

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: pursued the thief; had struggled with him; they had each tugged

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: at the coronet, their united strength causing injuries which

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: neither alone could have effected. He had returned with the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: prize, but had left a fragment in the grasp of his opponent. So

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: far I was clear. The question now was, who was the man and who

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: was it brought him the coronet?

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "It is an old maxim of mine that when you have excluded the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: truth. Now, I knew that it was not you who had brought it down,

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: so there only remained your niece and the maids. But if it were

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: the maids, why should your son allow himself to be accused in

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: their place? There could be no possible reason. As he loved his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: cousin, however, there was an excellent explanation why he should

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: retain her secret--the more so as the secret was a disgraceful

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: one. When I remembered that you had seen her at that window, and

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: how she had fainted on seeing the coronet again, my conjecture

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: became a certainty.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: circle of friends was a very limited one. But among them was Sir

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: George Burnwell. I had heard of him before as being a man of evil

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and retained the missing gems. Even though he knew that Arthur

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: had discovered him, he might still flatter himself that he was

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: safe, for the lad could not say a word without compromising his

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: own family.

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: "Well, your own good sense will suggest what measures I took

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: saw that they exactly fitted the tracks."

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET

text: "Precisely. It was I. I found that I had my man, so I came home

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
text: and changed my clothes. It was a delicate part which I had to

story: XI. THE ADVENTURE OF THE BERYL CORONET
